commit_message:
Rename overcloud-without-mergepy to overcloud.

Mergepy is gone. We can now rename our primary overcloud
template to be more sensible.

Change-Id: I14f5ff78b083b34590d30357df94c42ff6a0c2c0

Changes: logging.pp, db.pp and tests.

Set overview_days_range to 1

by default when rendering the Overview panel.

commit_message:
Fixed missing attribute in the data model

Querying compute.node.* with Ceilometer requires some additional
information in the cluster data model in order to build the
resource_id. This patchset add the attribute hostname and change
the query.

Change-Id: Ifcefcd70a6d0f5967ab4f638ce077e38ef214f64
Closes-Bug: #1521559

commit_message:
[microversions] Increase max version to 2.9

2.9 - Add a new locked attribute to the detailed view of servers. locked
will be true if anyone is currently holding a lock on the server, false
otherwise.

This microversion doesn't require any change in novaclient's code.
Just added functional tests and changed version

Change-Id: I7f33757e6f03f172e5a13ade0aa5e8d3a10dbf01

commit_message:
Add 'moved_read_only_property' descriptor

For when a existing property (class property or
instance property) has been renamed it is quite
useful to be able to deprecate the old name/location
and let users that access that property know when
they read the property what the new location is.

This adds a new descriptor that emits such a
warning in a format that matches the rest of the
debtcollector functions/decorators/descriptors.

Change-Id: I9305ba512856e957c06996b637acb4a8c4fa5d04

commit_message:
Fix fence_ssh python script

Import module atexit explicitly. Since a lot of packages were updated
during migration to CentOS7 this script no more works without that.
Probably it was imported implicitly, which is wrong anyway.

Fix command line options changes according to updated fencing.py

Remove test if needed shutdown slave because in any case all
that we do is just restart the slave. Always.

Blueprint: master-on-centos7

Compatible with CentOS6 & CentOS7 master node

Change-Id: I0437a71ac59a46eac58714bb28d78882987e5938

commit_message:
change return code and remove microversion info

This is the doc to talk about v2.1 and we should not
add microversion info into it. Also, the return code is
200 instead of 202 for os-virtual-interfaces GET.

Partial-Bug: #1515222

Change-Id: I7aeffedd6341f036cf8b44ea7cfdab8202bffccd

commit_message:
Make unit testing less reliant on HTML fragments

Some tests check for equality with quite large HTML fragments, when
the test is only interested in certain specific things (and not style
changes etc). This patch alters some of those tests (specifically ones
that were tripping up a dependent patch, but can be expanded) to check
the context data of the response, since the actual rendering is tested
by horizon's tests.

It also adds tests to check context data in 'normal' circumstances so
that no test coverage should be lost by this.

Change-Id: I09be82058edc923521ffb4c022515845a18b158d
Closes-Bug: #1517084

subject: Base install handler and compute install handler
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-20 01:41:02.000000000', 'files': ['octane/handlers/install/compute.py', 'octane/handlers/install/__init__.py'], 'message': 'Base install handler and compute install handler

Install handler is used in 2 cases:

* install additional controllers from scratch, based on controller node
  attributes from original environment
* reinstall compute node that failed to deploy after moving to the upgrade
  seed environment

Add compute handler for second use case.

Change-Id: Id0bfdf98637d7db70627f7d68bf0aa9da444c06e
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Base install handler and compute install handler

Install handler is used in 2 cases:

* install additional controllers from scratch, based on controller node
  attributes from original environment
* reinstall compute node that failed to deploy after moving to the upgrade
  seed environment

Add compute handler for second use case.

Change-Id: Id0bfdf98637d7db70627f7d68bf0aa9da444c06e

commit_message:
Fix awake AMT unit test

If test methods of awake AMT test case executed on the same process
with short time between executions tests fails. This patch adds
reset of AMT_AWAKE_CACHE to setUp() method.

Closes-bug: #1522789

Change-Id: I91c2e60bd2a3a1f97de3a7256e78815ddbbf8087

commit_message:
Rename image_client to images_client

Module names of service clients should be <resource name>s_client.py,
and class names also should be <resouce name>sClient.
So this patch renames image_client for matching to the naming rule.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: Id9d8488251d7b1a4642eab08270b787aa6c74050

MOS Ubuntu image uses Debian style packages. Since the introduction
of `$::os_package_type' fact avilable to use in project manifests,
we need to provide a manual override for Fuel Ubuntu images.

This commit updates the preseed template of Precise and Trusty.

Change-Id: I3f723c46e75dc7503cdc590c6b0d6c47822b4b85
Closes-Bug: #1517513
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Override $::os_package_type

MOS Ubuntu image uses Debian style packages. Since the introduction
of `$::os_package_type' fact avilable to use in project manifests,
we need to provide a manual override for Fuel Ubuntu images.

This commit updates the preseed template of Precise and Trusty.

Change-Id: I3f723c46e75dc7503cdc590c6b0d6c47822b4b85
Closes-Bug: #1517513

commit_message:
Hyper-V: removes *Utils modules and unit tests

Since HyperVDriver now uses the os-windows library, the
*Utils classes are no longer used.

Implements: blueprint add-os-win-library

commit_message:
Add --volume to Image `create`

This was previously part of the command, so added it in for backwards
compatibility. This adds the --volume command and the complimentary
--force command allowing users to create images from volumes.

It seems it may not be possible to add it to image set v2.

Change-Id: Ica36e70989f75d80959af3227f66708758fae68d

commit_message:
ACL support in Sahara UI

Sahara started support of is_public and
is_protected fields, so this change brings that
to sahara ui.

Change-Id: I67acfed8973afe2efd4ef046b1bf936cb9b2c3fa

commit_message:
Networking tests
[Author] Yury Tregubov
Added first draft of the https://mirantis.jira.com/browse/QA-449
Aim of the commit mostly is to share examples of how to work with the Neutrion API

in pathcset 4 and 5:
Removed some pep8 errors in patchset 3
Added fuelweb_test.tests.mos_integration.test_networking in
doc/base_tests.rst

in pathset 6:
Moved cleanup method to helpers/os_actions.py

Change-Id: I27bb08d3bf30b458fce859dcc3fc5ae87135e279

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-26 14:02:15.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Systemd syslog settings for astute, nailgun and ostf

Services astute, nailgun, ostf were converted to systemd units
in a set of requests:
* astute  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/248128
* nailgun https://review.openstack.org/#/c/248206
* ostf    https://review.openstack.org/#/c/248096

assassind, receiverd, statsenderd, oswl_* are a part of nailgun
so there is no separate request for them (included in 248206)

However, those commits add only service units.

This commit adds conf files with customized settings for those services.

Blueprint: master-on-centos7

Compatible with CentOS6 master node

Change-Id: I1808a0852d7c95079ae27540b77b1ae0035ab65b

commit_message:
Systemd syslog settings for astute, nailgun and ostf

Services astute, nailgun, ostf were converted  to systemd units
in a set of requests:
* astute  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/248128
* nailgun https://review.openstack.org/#/c/248206
* ostf    https://review.openstack.org/#/c/248096

assassind, receiverd, statsenderd, oswl_* are a part of nailgun
so there is no separate request for them (included in 248206)

However, those commits add only service units.

This commit adds conf files with customized settings for those services.

Blueprint: master-on-centos7

Compatible with CentOS6 master node.

Change-Id: I1808a0852d7c95079ae27540b77b1ae0035ab65b

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-19 14:01:05.000000000', 'files': ['reference/projects.yaml'], 'message': "Add vulnerability:managed to ironic(client)

Ironic was previously managed by the VMT, but that was somehow dropped
when the tag system was implemented. Add this tag for ironic and
python-ironicclient.

These deliverables meet all criteria laid out in the description of
this tag, except the third-party audit requirement (which may have been
done in the past and I'm just not aware of it). We're happy to try to

Change-Id: If897b0ae94a64150367abc4b7d57436c49627f4e
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Add vulnerability:managed to ironic(client)

Ironic was previously managed by the VMT, but that was somehow dropped
when the tag system was implemented. Add this tag for ironic and
python-ironicclient.

These deliverables meet all criteria laid out in the description of
this tag, except the third-party audit requirement (which may have been
done in the past and I'm just not aware of it). We're happy to try to
get a third party's eyes on the code if required.

Change-Id: If897b0ae94a64150367abc4b7d57436c49627f4e

subject: Fix broken "English" label in language-popover
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-12-04 09:37:50.000000000', 'files': ['nailgun/static/styles/main.less'], 'message': 'Fix broken "English" label in language-popover

CSS layout uses .popover-layout mixin, which fits the contents in a
pre-specified width (defaults to 260px). Popover classes include this
mixin so children widths are calculated during compile-time using Less
arithmetic expansions.

If a text node overflows the container word-wrapping rules would emerge
and cause this bug. Currently, offset calculations are implied by the
triangle arrow positioning stuff, which moves the popover container to
the right (using negative left offset) while moving the arrow (using
positive right offset). To preserve the correct layout, popover block
width should be known in prior.

Since the language menu has the leftmost offset, we can avoid these
calculations (still retaining current look-and-feel) by re-aligning the
arrow and setting the .language-popover left offset to zero. It would
allow as not to rely on a fixed width, so the box model will expand the
blocks as necessary to fit the text nodes.

(convert tabs to spaces since previous patchset)

Closes-Bug: 1522341
Change-Id: Icbe69db1e53bcd8ad89058fc3b24661ba294983f
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix broken "English" label in language-popover

CSS layout uses .popover-layout mixin, which fits the contents in a
pre-specified width (defaults to 260px). Popover classes include this
mixin so children widths are calculated during compile-time using Less
arithmetic expansions.

If a text node overflows the container word-wrapping rules would emerge
and cause this bug. Currently, offset calculations are implied by the
triangle arrow positioning stuff, which moves the popover container to
the right (using negative left offset) while moving the arrow (using
positive right offset). To preserve the correct layout, popover block
width should be known in prior.

Since the language menu has the leftmost offset, we can avoid these
calculations (still retaining current look-and-feel) by re-aligning the
arrow and setting the .language-popover left offset to zero. It would
allow as not to rely on a fixed width, so the box model will expand the
blocks as necessary to fit the text nodes.

(convert tabs to spaces since previous patchset)

Closes-Bug: 1522341
Change-Id: Icbe69db1e53bcd8ad89058fc3b24661ba294983f

seems to be truly alive. This is a fast and quite reliable way to
perform a simple instance monitoring.

commit_message:
Activate fping api extension

Nova will run fping for requested instances and report which ones
seems to be truly alive. This is a fast and quite reliable way to
perform a simple instance monitoring.

Change-Id: Ibc0d5de370b1878f774eef18b07ebbab98327d6e

On api-wg guideline[1], we recommend to use "server" on REST APIs

 server vs. instance

commit_message:
Change attribute on bp/abort-live-migration

On api-wg guideline[1], we recommend to use "server" on REST APIs
instead of "instance" like

 server vs. instance
   server shall be used to describe a virtual machine, a bare-metal
   machine, or a containerized virtual machine that is used by OpenStack
   users for compute purposes. The older term instance that is also by
   Amazon Web Services EC2 API to describe a virtual machine, should not
   be used in OpenStack REST APIs.

So this patch changes the attribute which contains "instance" for fitting
to the guideline.

Partially blueprint abort-live-migration

[1]: https://github.com/openstack/api-wg/blob/master/guidelines/terms.rst

Change-Id: I5c0fc31f958278d8052aa58e19c99cb4b800a8d3

subject: Add a part of api-wg guideline
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-12-03 01:49:25.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add a part of api-wg guideline

During nova-specs reviews, it is difficult to check all API changes
for following api-wg guideline because there is a lot of nova-specs
patches. There are some common mistakes against following guideline[1],
then this patch adds a part of the guideline to the template file for
avoiding these mistakes.

  REST API resource names
    * Resource names may include hyphens.
    * Resource names should not include underscores or other punctuation
      (sole exception is the hyphen).
  Fields in an API request or response body
    * Field names should use snake_case style, not CamelCase or MixedCase
      style.

[1]: https://github.com/openstack/api-wg/blob/master/guidelines/naming.rst

Change-Id: I20039ad1f7882cd5341431690b82dadab3cd1588
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-12-03 01:59:15.000000000', 'files': ['specs/mitaka-template.rst'], 'message': 'Add a part of api-wg guideline

During nova-specs reviews, it is difficult to check all API changes
for following api-wg guideline because there is a lot of nova-specs
patches. There are some common mistakes against following guideline[1],
then this patch adds a part of the guideline to the template file for
avoiding these mistakes.

  REST API resource names
    * Resource names may include hyphens.
    * Resource names should not include underscores or other punctuation
      (sole exception is the hyphen).
  Fields in an API request or response body
    * Field names should use snake_case style, not CamelCase or MixedCase
      style.

[1]: https://github.com/openstack/api-wg/blob/master/guidelines/naming.rst

Change-Id: I20039ad1f7882cd5341431690b82dadab3cd1588
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Add a part of api-wg guideline

During nova-specs reviews, it is difficult to check all API changes
for following api-wg guideline because there is a lot of nova-specs
patches. There are some common mistakes against following guideline[1],
then this patch adds a part of the guideline to the template file for
avoiding these mistakes.

  REST API resource names
    * Resource names may include hyphens.
    * Resource names should not include underscores or other punctuation
      (sole exception is the hyphen).
  Fields in an API request or response body
    * Field names should use snake_case style, not CamelCase or MixedCase
      style.

[1]: https://github.com/openstack/api-wg/blob/master/guidelines/naming.rst

Change-Id: I20039ad1f7882cd5341431690b82dadab3cd1588

commit_message:
Fix return 200 status code when we operate with nonexistent property

Glance returned 200 status code when we add/remove/replace element
to nonexistent "artifacts" property.
Now glance return 400 status code with description error.

Change-Id: Ifa9f92de0999052c4db4bcd44fba894f503c7378
Depends-On: I49a385f124236b22360ee07f5adcba27b3c92603
Closes-bug: #1485478

commit_message:
Include rabbitmq credentials for ceilometer for swift proxy

Now Swift template for proxy Ceilo is changed. We need to pass
Rabbitmq creds for correct work of Swift as Glance backend,
when Ceilometer is enabled.

Upstream puppet-fix: https://review.openstack.org/246988

Change-Id: I57d1c3c895d65be34d1afea345a9a4f9ee899446
Closes-bug: #1510064

hot resource security group example format change

commit_message:
Add missing bay_create_timeout to bay object

Currently bay-show command always shows "0" in bay_create_timeout, this
is confusing for users, store bay_create_timeout into db so that bay-show
will return correct bay_create_timeout value.

Change-Id: Icaea11d7d298bd6245a50c464bff6ff20292e092
Closes-Bug: #1521146

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 782, 'name': 'John Garbutt', 'email': 'john@johngarbutt.com', 'username': 'johngarbutt'}, {'_account_id': 1653, 'name': 'garyk', 'email': 'gkotton@vmware.com', 'username': 'garyk'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 6849, 'name': 'Roman Podoliaka', 'email': 'roman.podoliaka@gmail.com', 'username': 'rpodolyaka'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 7166, 'name': 'Sylvain Bauza', 'email': 'sbauza@redhat.com', 'username': 'sbauza'}, {'_account_id': 9732, 'name': 'Mellanox CI', 'email': 'mlnx-openstack-ci@dev.mellanox.co.il', 'username': 'mellanox', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 12898, 'name': 'Tony Breeds', 'email': 'tony@bakeyournoodle.com', 'username': 'tonyb'}, {'_account_id': 18940, 'name': 'Gyorgy Szombathelyi', 'email': 'gyurco@freemail.hu', 'username': 'gyurco78'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-12-01 09:14:24.000000000', 'files': ['nova/servicegroup/drivers/db.py', 'nova/tests/unit/servicegroup/test_db_servicegroup.py'], 'message': "servicegroup: stop zombie service due to exception

If an exception is raised out of the _report_state call, we find that
the service no longer reports any updates to the database, so the
service is considered dead, thus creating a kind of zombie service.

I55417a5b91282c69432bb2ab64441c5cea474d31 seems to introduce a
regression, which leads to nova-* services marked as 'down', if an
error happens in a remote nova-conductor while processing a state
report: only Timeout errors are currently handled, but other errors
are possible, e.g. a DBError (wrapped with RemoteError on RPC
client side), if a DB temporarily goes away. This unhandled exception
will effectively break the state reporting thread - service will be
up again only after restart.

While the intention of I55417a5b91282c69432bb2ab64441c5cea474d31 was
to avoid cathing all the possible exceptions, but it looks like we must
do that to avoid creating a zombie.
The other part of that change was to ensure that during upgrade, we do
not spam the log server about MessagingTimeouts while the
nova-conductors are being restarted. This change ensures that still
happens.

Closes-Bug: #1517926

Change-Id: I44f118f82fbb811b790222face4c74d79795fe21
(cherry picked from commit 49b0d1741c674714fabf24d8409810064b953202)
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
servicegroup: stop zombie service due to exception

If an exception is raised out of the _report_state call, we find that
the service no longer reports any updates to the database, so the
service is considered dead, thus creating a kind of zombie service.

I55417a5b91282c69432bb2ab64441c5cea474d31 seems to introduce a
regression, which leads to nova-* services marked as 'down', if an
error happens in a remote nova-conductor while processing a state
report: only Timeout errors are currently handled, but other errors
are possible, e.g. a DBError (wrapped with RemoteError on RPC
client side), if a DB temporarily goes away. This unhandled exception
will effectively break the state reporting thread - service will be
up again only after restart.

While the intention of I55417a5b91282c69432bb2ab64441c5cea474d31 was
to avoid cathing all the possible exceptions, but it looks like we must
do that to avoid creating a zombie.
The other part of that change was to ensure that during upgrade, we do
not spam the log server about MessagingTimeouts while the
nova-conductors are being restarted. This change ensures that still
happens.

Closes-Bug: #1517926

Change-Id: I44f118f82fbb811b790222face4c74d79795fe21
(cherry picked from commit 49b0d1741c674714fabf24d8409810064b953202)

commit_message:
Remove unused json_request()

Since I404e43e2e6ffecb5131cdcc43df03b8da0e7f0f8 which has added
json_request(), this method has never been used at all.
So this patch removes the method before migrating glance_http
module to tempest-lib.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: If20a33ea6adcdf91c4440f3efbf02b1388de9dbf

commit_message:
Rename private methods of glance_http

These methods are used in glance_http module only, and we will
migrate the module to tempest-lib with images_client together.
So it is necessary to clarify these methods as private ones.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: Id27a99ed9f6973c67d7df0601b5fae40ca562de7

can share it.

Change swarm's discovery member number from 1 to bay.master_count

commit_message:
turn neutron notifications off by default

unless something (ceilometer) is going to consume the notification
messages, we should turn notifications off.  This commit follows the
same pattern that the other roles use for enabling/disabling
notifications.

Bug: #1522042
Change-Id: If6d4f0fd1c441a6bd8dc48f6bea8a4906a9d96b2

be created with save "0600" (r--) permissions.
Additionally a new task will make sure that the file is removed
from the filesystem. This will mimize any unprivileged expsoure
to the nova-secret file content.

commit_message:
Creating nova-secret with safe file permissions

This fix will make sure that the nova-secret file will
be created with save "0600" (r--) permissions.

Additionally a new task will make sure that the file is removed
from the filesystem. This will minimize any unprivileged exposure
to the nova-secret file content.

Change-Id: I1c3ec322b2a661cf7dce0334866c90201bbef0a0
Closes-Bug: #1519088

commit_message:
Pass result of submit to wizard modal close

This passes the result of the submit function on to the modal close
function that gets called when the wizard modal is closed. This
allows the response to be handled following the wizard close.

Closes-Bug: #1521692
Change-Id: I259b7ff3133169a721b0923d9f790a08d9b692c8

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-08-03 02:09:35.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Remove error instance fail when enable serial_consol

When nova try to destroy instance, it will cleanup relative resources.
if we enable serial console, nova will try to find ports, which was
assigned to it, and release them. But the instance was created failed,
therefore nova will throw nova instance not found when find ports.

But the function, which find serial ports, had using yield keyword. When
it raise exception, it is not inside any try except block. Therefore
exception will be raised to top.

Change-Id: I9e9410ab7eec5fa667c0c3de4548c49df050c167
Closes-Bug: 1480514
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-08-17 01:31:35.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'libvirt: cleanup() serial_consoles after instance failure

When nova cleanup() is called to release all resources related to an instance
it can thow InstanceNotFound.  Which is not caught and therefore returned to
the user.

This is because the generator function (_get_serial_ports_from_instance)
is not *executed* under try/except.  While that is clearly the intent of the
code.

Change-Id: I9e9410ab7eec5fa667c0c3de4548c49df050c167
Closes-Bug: 1480514', 'number': 2}, {'created': '2015-08-17 15:33:12.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'message': 'libvirt: cleanup() serial_consoles after instance failure

When nova cleanup() is called to release all resources related to an instance
it can thow InstanceNotFound.  Which is not caught and therefore returned to
the user.

This is because the generator function (_get_serial_ports_from_instance)
is not *executed* under try/except.  While that is clearly the intent of the
code.

Change-Id: I9e9410ab7eec5fa667c0c3de4548c49df050c167
Closes-Bug: 1480514
', 'number': 3}]
commit_message:
libvirt: cleanup() serial_consoles after instance failure

When nova cleanup() is called to release all resources related to an instance
it can thow InstanceNotFound.  Which is not caught and therefore returned to
the user.

This is because the generator function (_get_serial_ports_from_instance)
is not *executed* under try/except.  While that is clearly the intent of the
code.

Change-Id: I9e9410ab7eec5fa667c0c3de4548c49df050c167
Closes-Bug: 1480514

commit_message:
EMC: Fix bugs when domain controller is not available

1. When the domain controller is not available, the share server failed to
delete because of an exception is thrown during the modification of the
cifs server.
2. Robust handling on nfs share query.

Change-Id: I4894a09b6bf695420f81577f8adfa8f34bd543b2
Closes-Bug: #1521903

commit_message:
Add requests to project requirements

The requests package is being used inside os-brick. While pretty much
every consumer of the os-brick library also uses requests, so we are fairly
safe, we should still list it in the requirements to make absolutely sure.

Closes-bug: #1507477
Change-Id: Id1a1d1faf057231e6358f902f35aa66f2e9e681a

commit_message:
Move update_policy parsing to Resource

Earlier update_policy was only used for InstanceGroup and ASG.
Now we've update_policy_schema defined in the Resource class. Therefore
it makes sense to move the parsing to Resource.__init__.

Change-Id: I623e4e6fc0c31f6fc01185f480d82cafbb4619e2

commit_message:
Implement the placeholders for the IPAM driver

This patch implements the request handlers for the API endpoints for
libnetwork's remote IPAM driver as the initial step for implementing the
complete IPAM driver. The following API endpints are defined in this
patch without the actual implementations but the example responses.

    - POST /IpamDriver.GetDefaultAddressSpaces
    - POST /IpamDriver.RequestPool
    - POST /IpamDriver.ReleasePool
    - POST /IpamDriver.RequestAddress
    - POST /IpamDriver.ReleaseAddress

They should be replaced with the real implementations with the
appropriate unit tests.

Change-Id: I200f22f20019b8e32e43148d9b31e21672c14454
Signed-off-by: Taku Fukushima <f.tac.mac@gmail.com>
Closes-Bug: #1520080
Related-bug: #1518249

commit_message:
Add jobs dashboard to docs

Adds dashboard to show the V2 API and Scenario jobs failure percentage
for the last 10 days.  This gives better visibility into the failure
rate of jobs and whether they need attention.

Change-Id: Ie2ce8b22167e5e06fd4862da0be6f007e37e800f

commit_message:
Change the default notification exchange to glance

As we agreed that we'll change the default notification exchange name
from 'openstack' to 'glance' in M release.

The openstack convention is to send out all the notifications to the
exchange with the same name as the project name, i.e. nova sends all its
notifications to the exchange 'nova', cinder sends all its notifications
to the exchange 'cinder', etc. In such way, other projects interested in
those notifications (e.g. ceilometer) can listen on different exchanges
for different notifications.

Change-Id: I658fb0896aecea4fd5db1a9d3a8bbb64a91a7224
Closes-Bug: #1467776

commit_message:
Location add catch bad Uri

If a location is added with the Uri 'file://' or something similar it
would cause the sever to raise a internal error. This now catches that
exception, so the server can raise a 400 error.

Closes-Bug: 1502850
Change-Id: I10e4a65dea4a951e00c8ed92d0c3cdd74a786ace

commit_message:
Correct reset_state_on_error() handling

The change Ic948c2fe5baf23c9c4ced33060f672ca9c278a19 aim
to prevent the stacks hanging in IN_PROGRESS, but the code
is incorrect, this patch fix them.

Change-Id: I0e9655b5a931452d810c38b7ddf6a2ce742bb7ed
Closes-Bug: #1521881
Related-Bug: #1492433

and moved to glance_store section. With glance_store 0.10.0, the

commit_message:
Move store config opt to glance_store section

Store config options under DEFAULT section have been marked deprecated
and moved to glance_store section. With glance_store 0.10.0, the
deprecated options have been dropped, which causes the scrubber tests
to fail as they still have filesystem_store_datadir under DEFAULT section.
So, moving it under glance_store section here.

Closes-Bug: 1522132

Change-Id: If5c11a2b616d3e0b577de34cc0286b18adc327c2
(cherry picked from commit d33bcc0b7c9ba30a6b68fc4a9d35a5e7f86294a4)

subject: Update lib/ironic to always skip cleaning
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2889, 'name': 'Aeva Black', 'email': 'aeva.online@gmail.com', 'username': 'tenbrae'}, {'_account_id': 5196, 'name': 'Matthew Treinish', 'email': 'mtreinish@kortar.org', 'username': 'treinish'}, {'_account_id': 6618, 'name': 'Ruby Loo', 'email': 'opensrloo@gmail.com', 'username': 'rloo'}, {'_account_id': 6773, 'name': 'Lucas Alvares Gomes', 'email': 'lucasagomes@gmail.com', 'username': 'lucasagomes'}, {'_account_id': 7118, 'name': 'Ian Wienand', 'email': 'iwienand@redhat.com', 'username': 'iwienand'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10239, 'name': 'Dmitry Tantsur', 'email': 'dtantsur@protonmail.com', 'username': 'dtantsur'}, {'_account_id': 10342, 'name': 'Jay Faulkner', 'display_name': 'JayF', 'email': 'jay@jvf.cc', 'username': 'JayF'}, {'_account_id': 10343, 'name': 'Jim Rollenhagen', 'email': 'jim@jimrollenhagen.com', 'username': 'jimrollenhagen'}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-12-03 17:25:58.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Update lib/ironic to always skip cleaning

Previously, devstack would disable ironic's cleaning phase if a driver
with "agent" in the name was used. However, we have begun using the IPA
ramdisk for all tests in the gate, which caused cleaning to be run for
the "pxe_ssh" job which therefore fails due to timeouts.

As a result, for now, we need to always disable cleaning.

As a point of record, we should actually be testing cleaning in the
gate. However, running 'shred' on the disks of a nested VM is too slow
and causes the gate to timeout // take too long. Some options have been
discussed for ways to test the callback mechanism but avoid actually
running 'shred' on the disks.

This needs to be revisited.

Change-Id: Id15cf6cc49122b08e557e44871b31a8c0d20b55d
Related-to-Bug: #1517277
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-12-03 17:45:16.000000000', 'files': ['lib/ironic'], 'message': 'Update lib/ironic to always skip cleaning

Previously, devstack would disable ironic's cleaning phase if a driver

As a result, for now, we need to always disable cleaning.

As a point of record, we should actually be testing cleaning in the
gate. However, running 'shred' on the disks of a nested VM is too slow
and causes the gate to timeout // take too long. Some options have been
discussed for ways to test the callback mechanism but avoid actually
running 'shred' on the disks.

This needs to be revisited.

Change-Id: Id15cf6cc49122b08e557e44871b31a8c0d20b55d
Related-to-Bug: #1517277
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Update lib/ironic to always skip cleaning

Previously, devstack would disable ironic's cleaning phase if a driver
with "agent" in the name was used. However, we have begun using the IPA
ramdisk for all tests in the gate, which caused cleaning to be run for
the "pxe_ssh" job which therefore fails due to timeouts.

As a result, for now, we need to always disable cleaning.

As a point of record, we should actually be testing cleaning in the
gate. However, running 'shred' on the disks of a nested VM is too slow
and causes the gate to timeout // take too long. Some options have been
discussed for ways to test the callback mechanism but avoid actually
running 'shred' on the disks.

This needs to be revisited.

Change-Id: Id15cf6cc49122b08e557e44871b31a8c0d20b55d
Related-to-Bug: #1517277

commit_message:
Use o.vo DictOfListOfStringsField

As of o.vo 0.7.0, there has been a DictOfListOfStringsField. So change
over nova's field to use o.vo's.

Change-Id: Ib2a50adf272e026be2035a153ad920865f98ace1

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-08 20:08:08.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Horizon Dropdown now inherits from Bootstrap Theme

Horizon dropdowns now use proper Bootstrap markup to allow for theme
inheritance.  It was noticed during this effort that Horizon was
using a mixture of <a> and <button> elements within dropdowns, and
having to override CSS so that their styles were shared.  This
created unnecessary complexity in the CSS:

http://getbootstrap.com/components/#dropdowns

It was also noted that we were passing Bootstrap classes defined in
the Python code to the templates through a static string that was
concatenated within all the other needed attributes.  This makes
overrides the templates with custom classes difficult.  New logic was
added to allow classes to be separate.  This more granular approach
was added to the table drop down templates.

Also, some of the replaced styles were making use of Flexbox.
Flexbox is not supported in IE9 and is only partially supported in
IE10:
  http://caniuse.com/#feat=flexbox

Partially-Implements: blueprint horizon-theme-css-reorg
Partially-Implements: blueprint bootstrap-html-standards
Partial-bug: #1490207

', 'number': 15}, {'created': '2015-11-21 16:46:56.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Horizon Dropdown now inherits from Bootstrap Theme

Horizon dropdowns now use proper Bootstrap markup to allow for theme
inheritance.  It was noticed during this effort that Horizon was
using a mixture of <a> and <button> elements within dropdowns, and
having to override CSS so that their styles were shared.  This
created unnecessary complexity in the CSS:

http://getbootstrap.com/components/#dropdowns

It was also noted that we were passing Bootstrap classes defined in
the Python code to the templates through a static string that was
concatenated within all the other needed attributes.  This makes
overriding the templates with custom classes difficult.  New logic was
added to allow classes to be separate.  This more granular approach
was added to the table drop down templates.

Also, some of the replaced styles were making use of Flexbox.
Flexbox is not supported in IE9 and is only partially supported in
IE10:
  http://caniuse.com/#feat=flexbox

Some tests needed to be updated, but these tests seems very fragile
in their implementation.  Fixing those tests to be less fragile is
outside of the scope of this effort, but will be addressed.

Partially-Implements: blueprint horizon-theme-css-reorg
Partially-Implements: blueprint bootstrap-html-standards
Partial-bug: #1490207

commit_message:
Horizon Dropdown now inherits from Bootstrap Theme

Horizon dropdowns now use proper Bootstrap markup to allow for theme
inheritance.  It was noticed during this effort that Horizon was
using a mixture of <a> and <button> elements within dropdowns, and
having to override CSS so that their styles were shared.  This
created unnecessary complexity in the CSS:

http://getbootstrap.com/components/#dropdowns

It was also noted that we were passing Bootstrap classes defined in
the Python code to the templates through a static string that was
concatenated within all the other needed attributes.  This makes
overriding the templates with custom classes difficult.  New logic was
added to allow classes to be separate.  This more granular approach
was added to the table drop down templates.

Partially-Implements: blueprint horizon-theme-css-reorg
Partially-Implements: blueprint bootstrap-html-standards
Partial-bug: #1490207

Change-Id: Id82999e5db37035968d39361ba9be4ff87c26f66

commit_message:
Add Bandit to tox for security static analysis

Bandit is a tool designed to find common security issues in
Python code. This change adds a bandit target to tox.ini.

The config file bandit.yaml was generated using bandit-config-generator

Run bandit:
    tox -e bandit

Change-Id: I3bd64e1e58d4dc460ce869c50818e9913fe1b9b8

commit_message:
fix functional gate

new keystone libs are breaking the functional tests. it seems
keystonemiddleware is implicitly being loaded when calling
prepare_service. we don't really need to call this so let's see
if it changes anything if we stop calling it.

Closes-Bug: #1522166
Change-Id: If01bcb6543fe164d79f785e20668106308244f75
(cherry picked from commit c14856a50d9a0c16e43abd79bdb2d82c7a24edfb)

commit_message:
Improve output when output resolve raises error

No neeed to raise error, if there's some errors during
resolving output in format_stack_output. This patch
add error message to dict with output_error key instead
of raising error.

Change-Id: I64050f6fd3456283947eafae2e51e86789089300

commit_message:
Add batching for samples creation in context

Performance Ceilometer scenarios required a great amount of data, that means
that if something happens during samples are storing the test fails.
Batching improves it. Storing with batching has the same rate as if whole
sample list is stored, but choosing batch size not greater then 1% of all
samples makes it losing not critical for the test.

Change-Id: I96cfbdb6f0f8c20363b4be11cac488f6459f81e2

commit_message:
Add 'volume_type' parameter to instance create

Allow the user to specify Cinder backend to use when creating a
volume.
Also, accept the 'volume_type' parameter in cluster create API.
The parameter is currently not used by any of the clustering
implementations.

Change-Id: I5415bcef7c9a50ef898a3f3fb74d4d61eca1c96f
Depends-On: Ied40b30ca738d815ca0a57971bb59f29ddc20b91
Implements-Blueprint: volume-type-on-create

commit_message:
Introduce FakeImage class

Introduce FakeImage to improve the current image unittest framework
with following two advantages:
1. generate more than one faking images
2. all faking images generated by random

Change-Id: Ide326fa2a047ddeea478bef97000083617a0b744
Implements: blueprint improve-image-unittest-framework

commit_message:
Add 'volume_type' parameter to instance create

An optional Cinder volume-type parameter was added to the instance
create command.
Also allow for 'volume_type' parameter in cluster create.

Note:
Had to change the way arguments get split.
Splitting by just 'volume' would conflict with
the 'volume_type' property.

Change-Id: Ied40b30ca738d815ca0a57971bb59f29ddc20b91
Implements-Blueprint: volume-type-on-create

subject: Fix race condition in stack listing
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-12-04 02:56:53.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/test_stack.py', 'heat/engine/stack.py'], 'message': 'Fix race condition in stack listing

When listing stacks, we first load them from the database, and then we
load their template in a different transaction. If a stack is deleted in
the mean time, loading the template will raise a NotFound exception, and
will make the listing returns NotFound, instead of ignoring that stack.
This patch handles the exception and continue to try to load stacks.

Change-Id: Iba6db81e3c10310955928fe723b84b5f62fc3fc1
Closes-Bug: #1508390
(cherry picked from commit 68bf3fcaad0fbaa932c719ce587266276a9cdd55)
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix race condition in stack listing

When listing stacks, we first load them from the database, and then we
load their template in a different transaction. If a stack is deleted in
the mean time, loading the template will raise a NotFound exception, and
will make the listing returns NotFound, instead of ignoring that stack.
This patch handles the exception and continue to try to load stacks.

Change-Id: Iba6db81e3c10310955928fe723b84b5f62fc3fc1
Closes-Bug: #1508390
(cherry picked from commit 68bf3fcaad0fbaa932c719ce587266276a9cdd55)

commit_message:
Fix race condition in stack listing

When listing stacks, we first load them from the database, and then we
load their template in a different transaction. If a stack is deleted in
the mean time, loading the template will raise a NotFound exception, and
will make the listing returns NotFound, instead of ignoring that stack.
This patch handles the exception and continue to try to load stacks.

Change-Id: Iba6db81e3c10310955928fe723b84b5f62fc3fc1
Closes-Bug: #1508390
(cherry picked from commit 68bf3fcaad0fbaa932c719ce587266276a9cdd55)

commit_message:
Revert "Delete python bytecode before every test run"

I don't like recompiling my Python files on each run.

This reverts commit ce8957f04ffc5277645c59ab05232ead04373913.

Change-Id: I34cd22d249a201d3f5c948075dbd762085818cab

commit_message:
add api-samples tox target

api-samples generation is no longer straight forward, now that tox is
blocking environment changes, and that PYTHONHASHSEED is randomized in
each run.

This creates a tox target to make it easy to generate the api-samples.

Change-Id: Ie88597fecee5ce81fb29ce2cfb73b15d60f3f389

commit_message:
Automated bandit checks in glance

Set up automated bandit checks using tox. These tests are intended to be
eventually suitable as automated gate tests.

Currently, several tests are disabled (and labeled with a TODO to enable
them). A future commit for each test will enable that test, fix all
associated false positives, and fix all associated real positives.

Change-Id: I290992be027eac180b3a0dfcf601465079c2915c
Partial-bug: 1511862

commit_message:
Make node delete request return no body

According to api-wg, DELETE request should not contain 'body'
in response, this patch removes it.

Change-Id: I4cd3469d620b185ca0eadfd90ffd48103cc8f3f2
partial-blueprint: http-response-modification

It's an override type, which means we need to know if it's set or not.
The default value for it is, well, obvious - since it's based on the

Change-Id: I5fe1d1dd5f0f1e34ec5eddf92cb6964cc389ca51
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Default for service service type should be empty

It's an override type, which means we need to know if it's set or not.
The default value for it is, well, obvious - since it's based on the
name. This was an oversight in the duplication of the method.

Change-Id: I5fe1d1dd5f0f1e34ec5eddf92cb6964cc389ca51

commit_message:
Correct the db connection string in dev-quickstart

mysql login requires password by default. We should change the DB
creation and connection string as below.

1. mysql -u root -pMYSQL_ROOT_PWD -e "create schema ironic"
2. sed -i ... root:MYSQL_ROOT_PWD@localhost ... ironic.conf.local

Change-Id: I19696a470055823a3b2edc45a48889945c255dfd
Closes-bug: #1520420

commit_message:
Stop using deprecated timeutils.total_seconds()

This function has been deprecated. It was only useful for Python <= 2.6.

Change-Id: Ic0ca83920e9ed0692277bf5d903d3df91d1adcde

commit_message:
Add translation jobs and change scripts for I18n repo

I18n repo contains a pot file which will be uploaded to Zanata and
maintain the translation.
The difference from common python projects is that the pot file is
not generated but manually created.
So add some new methods to handle uploading and downloading of I18n
repo translation files.

Change-Id: I24da74c49b3d106974f719d386857938fd789e2c
Implements: blueprint translation-glossary

commit_message:
Clean up FIP namespace in DVR functional tests

* Added FIP namespace cleanup to DVR router creation.
* The tests weren't actually verifying that the FIP namespace
  was being deleted.

Change-Id: I67287d397614ab368e940233c61738e0d77fbb2b
Closes-Bug: #1521820

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-12-03 07:21:26.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': '[CI] Speed up Tempest jobs

Manila CI jobs fail very often exceeding timeout.
So, do several changes to speed up Tempest jobs:

1) Separate NFS and CIFS tests between jobs.
Run NFS jobs on MySQL ones and CIFS on PostgreSQL.

2) Refactor couple of tests removing creation of redundant shares
testing the same things.

3) Increase amount of threads, to minimize probability of
running heavy test suites in one thread.

Change-Id: I6b60db039a96b47386f8ff538d1cb74559691ccc

commit_message:
[CI] Speed up Tempest jobs

Manila CI jobs fail very often exceeding timeout.
So, do several changes to speed up Tempest jobs:

1) Separate NFS and CIFS tests between jobs.
Run NFS jobs on MySQL ones and CIFS on PostgreSQL.

2) Refactor couple of tests removing creation of redundant shares
testing the same things.

3) Increase amount of threads, to minimize probability of
running heavy test suites in one thread.

Change-Id: I6b60db039a96b47386f8ff538d1cb74559691ccc

commit_message:
Delete python bytecode before every test run

Because python creates pyc files during tox runs, certain
changes in the tree, like deletes of files, or switching
branches, can create spurious errors.

Change-Id: I9b0e7afeeb934d24c9847573cd7582709e990c9e
Closes-Bug: #1368661

commit_message:
add lbaasv2 api validation check for delay and timeout values

In the option of lbaasv2 command
(neutron lbaas-healthmonitor-create/update),
"delay" must be greater than or equal to "timeout".
Since the lbaasv2 validation check that has not been performed,
it is not an error.

Change-Id: Id48abb7ca53f696568169603e389baacdee1be82
Closes-Bug: #1481666

commit_message:
delete python bytecode before every test run

Bring over the cleaning line from run_tests.sh for the pyc files to
all the tox runs.

This should eliminate the need to clean -x -i to kill pyc files in
your local directory to get tests to pass.

Change-Id: Ibcc824370ed3d48835780cca6c1075856f1dfacc
Closes-Bug: #1368661

commit_message:
Remove Python 2.6 classifier

OpenStack Mitaka release does not support Python 2.6 anymore. And
Magnum do not run any test against py26. So remove the classifier.

Change-Id: I2ab904f3f35455e2d50cd64ac84a52c6ed3d31a9
Closes-Bug: 1522620

commit_message:
Hide user credentials

When a user requests information about a stack created from the
template, the user credentials should not be showned. We need to
hide user credentials.

[1]http://docs.openstack.org/developer/heat/template_guide/
   hot_spec.html#parameters-section

Change-Id: Ide2040a3262cfcfaf020d08a2c2ae7782d517cc6
Partially-Implements: blueprint registryv2-in-master

commit_message:
configure ovs bridge in openvswitch-db container

- this change moves the ovs_ensure_configured.sh  file to the
  openvswitch-db container.
- this change reorders the plays in ansible/roles/neutron/tasks/start.yml
  to configure the ovs bridges before starting the vswitchd container.

Change-Id: Ied1a82d48377534c15680406df9a96caf3b79515
Closes-Bug: #1522133

subject: Remove py26 support
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-12-02 08:59:48.000000000', 'files': ['setup.cfg', 'tox.ini'], 'message': "Remove py26 support

As of mitaka, the infra team won't have the resources available to
reasonably test py26, also the oslo team is dropping py26 support
from their libraries. sine we rely on oslo for a lot of our work,
and depend on infra for our CI, we should drop py26 support too.

Change-Id: I6420a95a58c85830412ae5792208d952116ca7e6
Closes-Bug: 1519510
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Remove py26 support

As of mitaka, the infra team won't have the resources available to
reasonably test py26, also the oslo team is dropping py26 support
from their libraries. sine we rely on oslo for a lot of our work,
and depend on infra for our CI, we should drop py26 support too.

Change-Id: I6420a95a58c85830412ae5792208d952116ca7e6
Closes-Bug: 1519510

commit_message:
Code change for test case of removing _get_tenant_id_for_create()

As _get_tenant_id_for_create() is duplicated with process in
prepare_request_body(), it is not needed in the code. Patch[1]
has been submmitted to avoid duplicated code. This patch will
change code of testcase to meet the requirement of patch[1].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/241984/

Change-Id: Iafbada4a4232736116d7a61b5612de5ca8d473f6
Close-Bug: #1513825

[{'created': '2015-07-15 10:55:02.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'mech_sriov: vf cleanup on delete

Change-Id: Ifd33fbf9736cf636a37bdda8f48730ebe1a04e2d
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-07-15 11:57:36.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'mech_sriov: vf cleanup on delete

Change-Id: Ifd33fbf9736cf636a37bdda8f48730ebe1a04e2d
', 'number': 2}, {'created': '2015-07-16 11:26:37.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/ovs_neutron_agent.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/rpc.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/mech_sriov/agent/test_eswitch_manager.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/mech_sriov/agent/pci_lib.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/mech_sriov/agent/eswitch_manager.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/mech_sriov/agent/sriov_nic_agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/mech_sriov/agent/test_pci_lib.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/test_rpc.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/plugin.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/test_ovs_neutron_agent.py'], 'message': "[RFC] mech_sriov: vf cleanup on delete

Currently, in sriov setup VFs doesn't get cleaned up after
port deletion. Specifically, MAC and VLAN configuration that
was previously assigned stays untouched and gets changed
only next time when this device will be allocated.

This could lead to unexpected results, for example, user could
create a port with MAC address of some deleted port, but as
the VF of that specific deleted port wasn't cleaned up, user
could end up with two VFs with the same MAC address for example.

I have some concerns about this implementation (hence RFC in
commit title).

 * I had to modify port_delete interface in ml2.rpc to pass
   the port object instead of port_id as we need binding:profile
   information (specifically, PCI address) to clean things up
   and going back and forth from agent to plugin doesn't sound
   optimal. Not sure if such change is OK though.

 * It looks like this implementation could be a subject for possible
   races. For example:
     - plugin issues an async rpc cast to an agent
       and marks port deleted and device unallocated.
     - in the meantime, user starts a VM with new direct port
     - in the meantime, agent figures out pf/vf name from pci address
       and prepares to run 'ip link' command to erase settings from the vf
     - if user's VM wins the race and starts earlier, agent will flush
       its interface configuration.

 * I wasn't able to figure out a 'clean' way to reset MAC on VF.
   The closest thing that works is 'if link set .. vf .. mac 0'. It
   sets a MAC like '00:00:00:00:00:71'. However, I wasn't able to
   find any real issues that it's not '00:00:00:00:00:00' except
   that it looks a little strange.

Fixes bug #1475256
Change-Id: Ifd33fbf9736cf636a37bdda8f48730ebe1a04e2d
", 'number': 3}]
commit_message:
[RFC] mech_sriov: vf cleanup on delete

Currently, in sriov setup VFs doesn't get cleaned up after
port deletion. Specifically, MAC and VLAN configuration that
was previously assigned stays untouched and gets changed
only next time when this device will be allocated.

This could lead to unexpected results, for example, user could
create a port with MAC address of some deleted port, but as
the VF of that specific deleted port wasn't cleaned up, user
could end up with two VFs with the same MAC address for example.

I have some concerns about this implementation (hence RFC in
commit title).

 * I had to modify port_delete interface in ml2.rpc to pass
   the port object instead of port_id as we need binding:profile
   information (specifically, PCI address) to clean things up
   and going back and forth from agent to plugin doesn't sound
   optimal. Not sure if such change is OK though.

 * It looks like this implementation could be a subject for possible
   races. For example:
     - plugin issues an async rpc cast to an agent
       and marks port deleted and device unallocated.
     - in the meantime, user starts a VM with new direct port
     - in the meantime, agent figures out pf/vf name from pci address
       and prepares to run 'ip link' command to erase settings from the vf
     - if user's VM wins the race and starts earlier, agent will flush
       its interface configuration.

 * I wasn't able to figure out a 'clean' way to reset MAC on VF.
   The closest thing that works is 'if link set .. vf .. mac 0'. It
   sets a MAC like '00:00:00:00:00:71'. However, I wasn't able to
   find any real issues that it's not '00:00:00:00:00:00' except
   that it looks a little strange.

Fixes bug #1475256
Change-Id: Ifd33fbf9736cf636a37bdda8f48730ebe1a04e2d

commit_message:
[WIP] Moved on making linuxbrige agent an agent framework with plugable
agent-interface drivers (default linuxbridge).

Worked out an first interface for LinuxNetworkManager. This
still needs improvments!

Fixed unittests.

Change-Id: Ib91ecd938bc64b89b2b23e2ac663ad73408243c5
Related-Bug: #1468803

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-08-04 16:34:52.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/contrib/post_test_hook.sh'], 'message': "Don't generate testr logs in func tests

Currently the devstack-gate post hook that implements functional
testing processes the output from testr into HTML and compresses
it.  Devstack-gate itself does almost the exact same steps:

 http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack-infra/devstack-gate/tree/functions.sh?id=997283aae10500065c3637647438b00e9d24abed#n571

Because of this, we end up with these files:

./testr_results.html.gz
./logs/testr_results.html
./logs/testr_results.html.gz

The duplication is obviously not necessary, and the fact that there
is an uncompressed file defeats the purpose of compressing them,
and finally, the infra-root team gets notified of errors by our
maintenance scripts which try to compress the .html files again
and can not.

This change removes the processing of testr output from the post
test hook in favor of the version in devstack-gate.

Change-Id: Ib6cfa588dd05c0f58bde83a5eed63d1075e6a206
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Don't generate testr logs in func tests

Currently the devstack-gate post hook that implements functional
testing processes the output from testr into HTML and compresses
it.  Devstack-gate itself does almost the exact same steps:

 http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack-infra/devstack-gate/tree/functions.sh?id=997283aae10500065c3637647438b00e9d24abed#n571

Because of this, we end up with these files:

./testr_results.html.gz
./logs/testr_results.html
./logs/testr_results.html.gz

The duplication is obviously not necessary, and the fact that there
is an uncompressed file defeats the purpose of compressing them,
and finally, the infra-root team gets notified of errors by our
maintenance scripts which try to compress the .html files again
and can not.

This change removes the processing of testr output from the post
test hook in favor of the version in devstack-gate.

Change-Id: Ib6cfa588dd05c0f58bde83a5eed63d1075e6a206

commit_message:
Unify strongswan driver configuration

Move FedoraStrongswan driver into strongswan driver. Do not let user
decide which strongswan driver should be used, but automatically return
the correct one.

Change-Id: I9e1e95f2845363dd8791667ec3e0a958a2d82af2

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-27 17:13:01.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Add L3 HA fullstack failover test

* Generate unique internal and external router device names
  using the agent's hostname. This is to allow multiple HA
  router replicas to co-exist on the same machine, otherwise
  they'd all use the same device names and OVS would freak out.
* Add host.disconnect method that disconnects the host from
  the central internal and external bridges, simulating pulling
  the cable from the host's NIC.
* The new test itself is pretty self-explanatory.

Change-Id: I250fa41d89dfc4f9f3ba4c03a027b52b2e8c4b4b

commit_message:
Add L3 HA fullstack failover test

* Generate unique internal and external router device names
  using the agent's hostname. This is to allow multiple HA
  router replicas to co-exist on the same machine, otherwise
  they'd all use the same device names and OVS would freak out.
* Add host.disconnect method that disconnects the host from
  the central internal and external bridges, simulating pulling
  the cable from the host's NIC.
* Added a L3 HA failover test.
* Renamed fullstack/test_l3_agent to fullstack/test_l3.
* Removed the functional failover test, moved the other tests
  in its class to the other class in the module.

Change-Id: I250fa41d89dfc4f9f3ba4c03a027b52b2e8c4b4b

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-08-24 16:21:58.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_vpnaas/tests/unit/services/vpn/device_drivers/test_ipsec.py', 'etc/vpn_agent.ini', 'neutron_vpnaas/services/vpn/device_drivers/template/strongswan/strongswan.conf.template', 'neutron_vpnaas/services/vpn/device_drivers/ipsec.py', 'neutron_vpnaas/services/vpn/device_drivers/fedora_strongswan_ipsec.py'], 'message': "[WIP] Add MTU support for FedoraStrongSwan driver

StrongSwan supports setting mtu as well as OpenSwan with two major
differences:
    * StrongSwan allows setting the 'mtu' option only per vpn service
      (not per connection)
    * This option is not supported on Ubuntu version of StrongSwan
      (5.1.2) as it was introduced only in ver. 5.2.1

Add a config option 'mtu' for FedoraStrongSwan driver. This option
will be used to set up mtu in strongswan.conf and the mtu parameter
of an ipsec site connection will be ignored (maybe throw exception
if it is set?). Reloading config files in ensure_configs would allow
to update mtu value on the run.
As StrongSwan on Ubuntu doesn't support setting MTU, the config option
is added only for FedoraStrongSwan driver.

An alternative may be to enforce all ipsec connections belonging to
the same vpn service to have the same mtu, but that would involve
making db queries from driver on ipsec site connection create and
update operations which is more hacky and complicated.

DocImpact

Related-Bug: #1478949
Change-Id: Ic980fc7076a70ffa4af63a2f9ee2085d3ea4db16
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
[WIP] Add MTU support for FedoraStrongSwan driver

StrongSwan supports setting mtu as well as OpenSwan with two major
differences:
    * StrongSwan allows setting the 'mtu' option only per vpn service
      (not per connection)
    * This option is not supported on Ubuntu version of StrongSwan
      (5.1.2) as it was introduced only in ver. 5.2.1

Add a config option 'mtu' for FedoraStrongSwan driver. This option
will be used to set up mtu in strongswan.conf and the mtu parameter
of an ipsec site connection will be ignored (maybe throw exception
if it is set?). Reloading config files in ensure_configs would allow
to update mtu value on the run.
As StrongSwan on Ubuntu doesn't support setting MTU, the config option
is added only for FedoraStrongSwan driver.

An alternative may be to enforce all ipsec connections belonging to
the same vpn service to have the same mtu, but that would involve
making db queries from driver on ipsec site connection create and
update operations which is more hacky and complicated.

DocImpact

Related-Bug: #1478949
Change-Id: Ic980fc7076a70ffa4af63a2f9ee2085d3ea4db16

commit_message:
Fixes Floatingip_agent_gw_port delete failure with DVR

Floatingip_agent_gw_port delete throws a server fault
error when trying to delete the port, since it could
not find the "_delete_port" function with ML2Plugin.

This was causing the Tempest test on FloatingIPsTestJSON
to fail on couple of tests.

This patch fixes the above mentioned problem by calling
the right public functions instead of calling the
internal private functions.

Change-Id: I052fca07e2f13c805bcb09301a6bd05449554355
Closes-Bug: #1475011

commit_message:
Remove unused payload parameter

routers_updated doesn't use its 'data' parameter, no point
in sending anything. I did not want to remove the parameter
entirely as I don't know if it's used by out of repo projects.

Change-Id: I64d45159da11b13b70232f5af376a546f9f2e889

commit_message:
[neutron-db-manage] Add check for branches

Check that migrations from contract branch doesn't contain create/add
alembic commands and migrations from expand branch doesn't contain
drop commands.

Partially-Implements: blueprint online-schema-migrations

Related-bug: #1490767

Change-Id: Ifb7bc4b272d7c8de3282019f53f9f618e8f5c158

[{'created': '2015-08-05 05:58:08.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/l3/ha_router.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/agent/test_l3_agent.py'], 'message': 'Update HA Router state to backup before deletion

When admin_state_up of an L3 Agent hosting HA router is set to False, Neutron
deletes the HA router from the agent, and one of the backup HA routers would
take over the role of Master. In such a situation, when we query the active
agent hosting HA router, we see the same old state for the HA router on that
agent.

This patch fixes the issue by sending out the state change notification just
before terminating the HA Router.

Closes-Bug: #1481588
Change-Id: Iad7a953de23a5126fe16f20410fd94f61da83fb7
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Update HA Router state to backup before deletion

When admin_state_up of an L3 Agent hosting HA router is set to False, Neutron
deletes the HA router from the agent, and one of the backup HA routers would
take over the role of Master. In such a situation, when we query the active
agent hosting HA router, we see the same old state for the HA router on that
agent.

This patch fixes the issue by sending out the state change notification just
before terminating the HA Router.

Closes-Bug: #1481588
Change-Id: Iad7a953de23a5126fe16f20410fd94f61da83fb7

commit_message:
Linuxbridge agent pass the config as parameter

Instead of using the global cfg.CONF, we enable linuxbridge agent
to pass the config as parameter like openvswith agent.
This is very useful to test the agent without having to override
the global config.

Closes-Bug: #1493424
Change-Id: I4c0ef5be9c87c9bf4e5d71bc73889881a3a10ef7

commit_message:
Move logic to handle OVS status out of rpc_loop

Introduce handle_ovs_status to factor the logic to
handle OVS status out of rpc_loop

Change-Id: I7defd270db14f103c86b1a3e29eea2ea9f2cc0db

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-05-01 18:06:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'provide snat dvr host name during FIP association with unbound port

Change-Id: I8e94063009b29fab4f990674292989aaca572491
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-05-01 21:58:29.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'provide snat dvr host name during FIP association with unbound port

Change-Id: I8e94063009b29fab4f990674292989aaca572491
', 'number': 2}, {'created': '2015-05-05 22:50:29.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "provide snat dvr host name during FIP association with unbound port

Floating agent gw port is only created for compute host when floating ip is associated
with a VM resided on this host. If associate neutron port with floating IP before booting
a VM with that port, floating agent gw port won't be created (in case this is the first VM
scheduled to a compute host).

In that case l3 agent on compute host will receive router info with floating ip but no
floating agent gw port: it will subscribe the router for fip namespace but namespace itself
won't be created

In order to have floating agent gw port created in unbound port scenario, a host has to
be assigned to the unbound port during floating IP assocaiton process. The fix is to pick the
first snat dvr host name as there is no compute host at this point.  Once this issue gets taken
care of, floating agent gw port will be created when floating Ip associated with this unbound
port.  And fip namespace can be created successfully after VM is on that unbund port.

Change-Id: I8e94063009b29fab4f990674292989aaca572491
bug-id: #1447034

agent gw port won't be created (in case this is the first VM scheduled
to a compute host).

In that case l3 agent on compute host will receive router info with
floating ip but no floating agent gw port: it will subscribe the
router for fip namespace but namespace itself won't be created

In order to have floating agent gw port created in unbound port
scenario, a host has to be assigned to the unbound port during
floating IP association process. The fix is to pick the first snat dvr
host name as there is no compute host at this point.  Once this issue
gets taken care of, floating agent gw port will be created when
floating IP associated with this unbound port. And fip namespace can
be created successfully after VM is on that unbound port.

Change-Id: I8e94063009b29fab4f990674292989aaca572491
Partial-Bug: #1447034

commit_message:
Use 1st SNAT DVR host name for FIP assoc w/unbound

Floating agent gw port is only created for compute host when floating
IP is associated with a VM resided on this host. If associate neutron
port with floating IP before booting a VM with that port, floating
agent gw port won't be created (in case this is the first VM scheduled
to a compute host).

In that case l3 agent on compute host will receive router info with
floating ip but no floating agent gw port: it will subscribe the
router for fip namespace but namespace itself won't be created

In order to have floating agent gw port created in unbound port
scenario, a host has to be assigned to the unbound port during
floating IP association process. The fix is to pick the first snat dvr
host name as there is no compute host at this point.  Once this issue
gets taken care of, floating agent gw port will be created when
floating IP associated with this unbound port. And fip namespace can
be created successfully after VM is on that unbound port.

Change-Id: I8e94063009b29fab4f990674292989aaca572491
Partial-Bug: #1447034

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-02-12 08:24:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Add state_or_sec_group_updated flag in port_update

port_update notification is sent when an attribute
of a port is modified. The OVS agent uses
this notification to keep track of the ports that
need to be reprocessed. Anyway not all the changes
that can affect a port require the L2 to react.
Add a flag in port_update to indicate that the state,
the IP or the security group changed for a port.
The L2 agent can use this information to avoid processing
a port when it's not needed.

Change-Id: I0ce3527a2f218f3fda231f724b82a68e031a23be
Partially-Implements: blueprint restructure-l2-agent

", 'number': 8}, {'created': '2015-04-13 16:22:08.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add updated_attrs in port_update

port_update notification is sent when an attribute
of a port is modified. The OVS agent uses
that notification to keep track of the ports that
need to be reprocessed. Anyway not all the changes
that can affect a port require the port to be
reprocessed. Add updated_attrs in port_update to
keep track of which attribute was updated. The
OVS agent uses that list to determine if a port
needs to be reprocessed or if updating the firewall
is enough.

Change-Id: I0ce3527a2f218f3fda231f724b82a68e031a23be
Partially-Implements: blueprint restructure-l2-agent

commit_message:
Add updated_attrs in port_update

port_update notification is sent when an attribute
of a port is modified. The OVS agent uses
that notification to keep track of the ports that
need to be reprocessed. Anyway not all the changes
that can affect a port require the port to be
reprocessed. Add updated_attrs in port_update to
keep track of which attribute was updated. The
L2 agent uses that list to determine if a port
needs to be reprocessed or if updating the firewall
is enough.

Change-Id: I0ce3527a2f218f3fda231f724b82a68e031a23be
Partially-Implements: blueprint restructure-l2-agent

commit_message:
db_base: Make delete_port raise NotFound if port is not found

Previously, if one called delete_port() and the port was not found
in the db the caller would not know. This patch updates the code
so that a PortNotFound exception is raised instead so the caller
knows that the port has already deleted.

Change-Id: I4737dc33ea32c2f90e7a050f2705d068041bbeaf
related-bug: #1496554

[{'created': '2015-08-26 10:55:21.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fix algorithm error in _modify_rules

In function _modify_rules of iptables_manager.py, the first rule
position in 'new_filter' was found early, and saved to variant
'rules_index'. while removed rule from 'new_filter', reduce the
position 'rules_index' by one, this is incorrect logic, because
chains at the front of rules, the 'rules_index' was depend on
numbers of chains. So 'rules_index' should be changed while
removed chain.

Actually, this logic can be simple, just found the 'new_filter'
before use it, remove any statements changed 'new_filter'.

Closes-Bug: #1488747

commit_message:
Simplifies logic in _modify_rules

In '_modify_rules' method of iptables_manager.py, rules_index(first rule
position) can be determined in the later part of the method. Currently
rules_index value is determined early in the function and recalculated
again depending on the changes to filter.

This patch simplifies the logic by determining the 'rules_index' only
after the rules filter has the final data.

Closes-Bug: #1488747
Change-Id: I07aebbe552399e26e3dfd081827e3cf88d7f031c

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-08-10 14:25:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Remove cache of registered ports in the OVS agent

The OVS agent doesn't need to keep track of which port has
processed anymore since it consumes the events provided by
ovsdb monitor.
scan_ports and scan_ancillary_ports are called only if a resync
is needed, modify those methods to return all ports currently on
the machine as added ports.
Unit tests are modified accordingly.

Partially-Implements: blueprint restructure-l2-agent

commit_message:
Remove cache of registered ports in the OVS agent

The OVS agent doesn't need to keep track of which port has
processed anymore since it consumes the events provided by
ovsdb monitor.
scan_ports and scan_ancillary_ports are called only if a resync
is needed, modify those methods to return all ports currently on
the machine as added ports.
Unit tests are modified accordingly.

Partially-Implements: blueprint restructure-l2-agent
Change-Id: Icfd7a2b7bfe30ce0d28808fefd6e3a360ebbe062

commit_message:
Refactor tunnel_sync to handle race conditions

We have a concern that we may have race conditions with existing
tunnel_sync logic with delete endpoint.

This patch-set introduces the update endpoint methods for updating
the values in VXLAN/GRE endpoint tables.

As part of code refactoring this patch-set improves the logging in
tunnel_sync for better debuging and troubleshooting.

The detailed problem statement is available in the bug description.
Closes-Bug: #1426427

Change-Id: Ic119d14e4d6a2d6d04c4288b9b0242475adf55d6

commit_message:
bind port maybe endless in the concurrent thread

the variable level may be greater than MAX_BINDING_LEVELS in
 concurrent thread,then the loop will be endless
 when the port can not be binded.

Change-Id: I0c183fc6a53e327af4a6e7a2202a2904eefce1c4

commit_message:
DO NOT MERGE - test change

This is to test that neutron changes will run VPN funcitonal tests,
in the check queue.

This patch has a change in Neutron that will cause VPN functional
test for strongswan (at least) to fail. It is testing against
stable/kilo to verify that the job works there.

Part of the neutron-lib work.

Change-Id: I8beec9e95f9c2d288eef6e6f75ece62e870112c2

commit_message:
[WIP] Linux Bridge: Create a configurable network manager class

Create a superclass that LinuxBridgeManager inherits from, and create a
configuration option for the Linux Bridge Agent to allow other types of
VIF plugging strategies (like macvtap) to co-exist within the Linux
Bridge agent.

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-August/071416.html

Change-Id: Ic15c4839c54fa1645953bcccdd14279838e5c816
Related-Bug: #1468803

commit_message:
Exception will not be raised when Port Security is not enabled

if port_data.get(psec.PORTSECURITY) is None, the variable
 port_security is True, so AddressPairAndPortSecurityRequired
exception will not be raised for ever.

Change-Id: I7e9a8022adcdfdc30c3fc528ed84b6570c8df291

I've wondered why this is here.  The network_id is redundant with the
subnet_id because the subnet_id is a UUID and associates with the
network.

A quick look through the code where IPAllocation is queried, there are
a handful of places where the network_id is used in the filter but
subnet_id is always supplied too.  I don't see any queries that need

Change-Id: I90abb88306ce43dfb7fcb7decb0c40b7c8f55e46
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
WIP Remove explicit network_id from IPAllocation

I've wondered why this is here.  The network_id is redundant with the
subnet_id because the subnet_id is a UUID and associates with the
network.

A quick look through the code where IPAllocation is queried, there are
a handful of places where the network_id is used in the filter but
subnet_id is always supplied too.  I don't see any queries that need
to filter on it.

Change-Id: I90abb88306ce43dfb7fcb7decb0c40b7c8f55e46

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-09-16 23:42:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Avoid the select and delete sql pattern

The following pattern:

 selected = query.filter(...).one()
 context.session.delete(selected)

is commonly used in Neutron but racy because selected can be deleted
between the select and the delete, we should prefer the pattern:

 count = query.filter(...).delete(synchronize_session=False)
 if not count:
     raise NotFound

We can set synchronize_session=False as the selected row is no
more used in session context.

TODO:
* handle remaining cases
* query.delete() doesn't offer in-python relationship cascading, so i
  need to check that

Closes-Bug: #1496586
Change-Id: Ic5136e2a9d6a6fc5a12a81ca4c2a5f9f1450901d
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-09-18 23:25:34.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/brocade/db/models.py', 'neutron/db/agents_db.py', 'neutron/db/securitygroups_db.py', 'doc/source/devref/effective_neutron.rst', 'neutron/db/qos/api.py', 'neutron/db/address_scope_db.py', 'neutron/db/db_base_plugin_v2.py', 'neutron/db/metering/metering_db.py', 'neutron/db/flavors_db.py'], 'message': 'Avoid the select and delete sql pattern

The following pattern:

 selected = session.query(model).filter(<on primary key>).one()
 context.session.delete(selected)

is commonly used in Neutron but racy because selected can be deleted
between the select and the delete.

We should prefer the non-racy pattern:

 # we set synchronize_session=False because the selected row is no more
 # used in session context
 count = (session.query(model).filter(<on primary key>).
          delete(synchronize_session=False))
 if not count:
     raise NotFound

except when sqlalchemy "after_delete" events are used to trace deletes
in model table. Indeed the 2 patterns raise different sqlalchemy events:

* Session.delete(1st pattern) raises "after_delete" events
* Query.delete(2nd pattern) raises "after_bulk_delete" events

And at the moment, neutron uses sqlalchemy "after_delete" events to track
resource quotas[1].

This change replaces when possible the 1st pattern by the 2nd pattern or
explicits why we should use 1st pattern.

[1] neutron.quota.resource

Closes-Bug: #1496586
Change-Id: Ic5136e2a9d6a6fc5a12a81ca4c2a5f9f1450901d
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Avoid the select and delete sql pattern

The following pattern:

 selected = session.query(model).filter(<on primary key>).one()
 context.session.delete(selected)

is commonly used in Neutron but racy because selected can be deleted
between the select and the delete.

We should prefer the non-racy pattern:

 # we set synchronize_session=False because the selected row is no more
 # used in session context
 count = (session.query(model).filter(<on primary key>).
          delete(synchronize_session=False))
 if not count:
     raise NotFound

except when sqlalchemy "after_delete" events are used to trace deletes
in model table. Indeed the 2 patterns raise different sqlalchemy events:

* Session.delete(1st pattern) raises "after_delete" events
* Query.delete(2nd pattern) raises "after_bulk_delete" events

And at the moment, neutron uses sqlalchemy "after_delete" events to track
resource quotas[1].

This change replaces when possible the 1st pattern by the 2nd pattern or
explicits why we should use 1st pattern.

[1] neutron.quota.resource

Closes-Bug: #1496586
Change-Id: Ic5136e2a9d6a6fc5a12a81ca4c2a5f9f1450901d

[{'created': '2015-04-17 21:33:03.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Make idl available before starting ovsdb connection

It can be useful to be able to access the Idl object before the
connection thread is started. The Idl object will not actually
establish an connection until it is run().

Work is being done in the Python OVS library to allow access to
the create/update/delete events that the IDL library parses. To
be able to access the initial events, setting up the the listner
on the IDL object before the connection is started wil be required.

Change-Id: I8d2884fe32f9ccdcd7539366e0baf055a232f2cd

commit_message:
Make it possible for subclasses of Idl to be used

The OVS library now allows registering a notification hook by
subclassing the Idl class and defining a notify() method. To
be able to use this in both Neutron and networking-ovn, it must
be possible for the Connection object to use a subclassed Idl.

This patch allows either an Idl object to be passed to the
Connection, or for the library user to subclass Connection and
override the create_idl method.

The plan is for Neutron to be able to use this to avoid having to
spawn ovsdb-client monitor for syncing. networking-ovn will use
this to notify neutron of port status changes.

Closes-Bug: #1449263
Change-Id: I8d2884fe32f9ccdcd7539366e0baf055a232f2cd

Support CLI changes for managing trunk ports

This patch adds the command line support for
vlan-aware-vms trunk ports.

DocImpact

commit_message:
delete the redundant 'if len(network_ids) == 1'

the 2 condition can merge 1,for
"if len(network_ids) == 1" then
NetworkDhcpAgentBinding.network_id in network_ids

Change-Id: Iaf0d97d3186343ac8fc342213269d4bc44fbf0eb

commit_message:
Avoid duplicate calls to get_snat_port_for_internal_port

L3 agents internal_network_added function and
_dvr_internal_network_removed function makes a call
to get_snat_port-for_internal_port in the case of
DVR routers.

But there are duplicate calls to the same function
when snat is configured for the router interface.

This patch avoids the duplicate calls.

Closes-Bug: #1499045

Change-Id: If6e119e10fd6af5824500e298f788fe90f2e6aed

commit_message:
[WIP] Logging API for security group and firewall rule

We would like to implement a logging API for security group and firewall rule
in order to make the trouble shooting process easier for operators
(or Cloud admins, developers etc).

This is implementation for the RFE that is tracked by [1]
and based on specification by [2]

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1468366
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/203509/

Change-Id: I44837e31a713b6f2d20aa07bc38ef67265543d1a
Co-Authored-By: Yushiro FURUKAWA <y.furukawa_2@jp.fujitsu.com>

commit_message:
GreenThread should be created when network admin_state is up

the GreenThread that configure dhcp should be created when
 admin_state is up, that is to say network.admin_state_up
 is True in function sync_state. no need to create
greenthread when admin_state is down.

Change-Id: Idf36d15e84aac631fa14909d78f2abd9b8958ee8
Closes-bug: #1497570.
