commit_message:
Avoid adding flood flow when l2pop is enabled
When ovs agent start, it should not add tunnel flood flow when l2pop is enabled, because later when port is up, plugin will instructs ovs agent to install the corresponding fdb entry
Fixes Bug1312257

Change-Id: I7a44be0d12b18fc3378a4a26d8f605257d04954b

commit_message:
Use constants directly from neutron.common.constants in l3_db

Use constants directly from neutron.common.constants in l3_db
instead of defining a local constant pointing to the one in
neutron.common.constants.

Recently there was a patch that fixed constants in l3_dvr_db,
but did not touch the l3_db and this patch does the job.

Change-Id: I19c6d6d659036b6ef5762da6186c6af601cfc216

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-08-28 10:16:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "treat skipped updated devices as removed

In function 'treat_devices_added_or_updated', if updated device
just removed from br-int before processing it, the device added
into 'skipped_devices', and the device removed from the set of
'current', the device's sg rules never removed from iptables.

This patch add skipped updated devices into set of 'removed',
let ovs_agent removing all sg rules about these devices.

Closes-Bug: #1489690
Change-Id: I1c211545fe6c1d5c4f13f3550b7a07f461c2b1ad
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-09-01 03:52:48.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "treat skipped updated devices as removed

In function 'treat_devices_added_or_updated', if updated device
just removed from br-int before processing it, the device added
into 'skipped_devices', and the device removed from the set of
'current', the device's sg rules never removed from iptables.

This patch add skipped updated devices into set of 'removed',
let ovs_agent removing all sg rules about these devices.

commit_message:
leave skipped updated devices in 'current'

In function 'treat_devices_added_or_updated', if updated device
just removed from br-int before processing it, the device added
into 'skipped_devices', and the device removed from the set of
'current', the device's sg rules never removed from iptables.

This patch leave skipped updated devices in set of 'current',
let ovs_agent removing all sg rules about these devices.

Closes-Bug: #1489690
Change-Id: I1c211545fe6c1d5c4f13f3550b7a07f461c2b1ad

Allocate segment id fail with concurrency requests

Start multi neutron-server and create vxlan network with 1000
concurrency requests, but 200 return with success.

Change-Id: I4c2ea926b699af6ea4a8104fef09c2b002486dec
Closes-Bug: #1418283

commit_message:
Avoid stacktrace when dhcp port is deleted

When a dhcp port is deleted using the neutron API, dhcp agent
dumps lots of stacktrace messages (which makes debugging gate
failures a bit difficult) and re-creates the dhcp port.
This patch modifies the stacktrace to a simple warning and retains
the current behavior of re-creating [1] the dhcp-port in such situations.

[1] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/neutron/commit/?id=9d80002

Closes-Bug: #1477190
Change-Id: I7e8ef4edd320a0f8cd6fa51ff50140435e8f1f12

commit_message:
To support ICMP codes in range [0,255]

firewall rules doesn't support to set port/port range in
 range [0,255] when selecting ICMP protocol. ICMP codes
should support to be set in range [0,255]

Closes-Bug: #1492547

commit_message:
Fix cannot find device "qr" while updating arp

Logtrace for l3 agent shows errors related to
"cannot find device qr" while trying to update
an arp entry for the DVR routers.

This might happen if the device was concurrently
deleted or when the device was not created.
So it makes sense to check for the device before
trying to update an arp entry in the namespace.

If the device does not exist log a warning
message instead of throwing an exception.

This patch fixes the problem seen in the log
trace.

Related-Bug: #1419175
Change-Id: I128b9d2172690ac6854e05582fa3f05fb0ca876b

commit_message:
Security Group API: Ensure attributes are validated as UUIDs

In the API, security_group_id and remote_group_id are documented
as requiring UUIDs.

http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/api-site/tree/api-ref/src/wadls/netconn-api/src/security-groups.wadl#n347

http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/api-site/tree/api-ref/src/wadls/netconn-api/src/security-groups.wadl#n382

APIImpact

Closes-Bug: #1470076

Change-Id: I95c570d4d8b1b0b30f2ded64f11716ca9d5f8a3b

commit_message:
Make subnet_id for lbaas v2 member create optional

Presently subnet id is required for creating lbaas v2 member.
This patch makes subnet id optional for creating the member

DocImpact
APIImpact

Change-Id: I2b0619eee8dfad05c5824cf8c1f4d3f8ffd77c26
Closes-bug: #1426251

Document leastrouter scheduling

Adds description of leastrouter option

Describes the router assignment behaviour of the LeastRoutersScheduler
option.
Closes-Bug: #1325458

[{'created': '2015-08-03 22:06:41.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': '[WIP] Linux Bridge Agent Restructuring

Basically I want the Linux Bridge agent to become like the
OVSNeutronAgent, which inherits from the RPC mixins, rather than having
a two separate classes with some interesting interactions between.

* Move OVS port and network handling into common l2agent class
* Merge LinuxBridgeRpcCallbacks and LinuxBridgeNeutronAgentRPC into a
  class - LinuxBridgeNeutronAgent.
* Hacked up tests

commit_message:
[WIP] Linux Bridge Agent Restructuring

Basically I want the Linux Bridge agent to become like the
OVSNeutronAgent, which inherits from the RPC mixins, rather than having
a two separate classes with some interesting interactions between.

Merge LinuxBridgeRpcCallbacks and LinuxBridgeNeutronAgentRPC into a
class - LinuxBridgeNeutronAgent.

Related-Bug: #1468803
Co-Authored-By: Andreas Scheuring <andreas.scheuring@de.ibm.com>

Change-Id: I3473d256009e89defc7a1b6bdb33448fdec451ac

commit_message:
Update LBaaS L7 extension spec to reflect reality

Now that we are actually implementing Neutron LBaaS L7 functionality,
we have discovered a few discrepancies between what this spec
describes, and what we are actually having to code. This update should
bring the spec in line with what we are actually coding.

Change-Id: Iec33c480bedfb3f1504751a35bc405c5100432ef

commit_message:
Register net-update options to show help info

Register net-update options to show help info. For bool type
attributes, two options are introduced like --enable and --disable
to avoid manually passing bool parameters, similar to subnet-update
commmand.

Change-Id: I3fe1e4ca90d31b43c9ed2cf47e520b862d618a43
Closes-Bug: #1406386

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-09-11 10:09:27.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Get method to retrieve firewall handle.

The implementation of this blueprint will enable
L2 neutron agent to concurrently do port binding.
The concurrency is achieved by carrying out port
binding in multiprocess (process for short interval)
environment where each process will need firewall
handle to apply security group (i.e. SG) rules.
This method will allow short living process to get
firewall handle.

Partially implements: blueprint scale-hyperv-neutron-agent

Change-Id: Iaad9d1560863ccf7092f4d01ac8ffc5c08574a0c

Change-Id: Iaad9d1560863ccf7092f4d01ac8ffc5c08574a0c
", 'number': 5}, {'created': '2015-10-06 09:29:04.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Hyper-V Concurrency, config & refactor l2_agent

The implementation of this blueprint will enable
L2 neutron agent to concurrently do port binding.
The concurrency is achieved by carrying out port
binding in multiprocess (process for short interval)
environment where each process will need firewall
handle to apply security group (i.e. SG) rules.
This method will allow short living process to get
firewall handle.

main() method in hyperv_neutron_agent.py is
changed to pass cmd line argument, the arguments
will decide which methods to be invoker in class
"HyperVNeutronAgent" in parent and child process
context.

New config parameters are introduced to decide
on how many parallel child process can created
for port processing, and on failure how many
retires are allowed before giving up.

l2_agent.py file is re-factored to support
concurrent port binding.

Partially implements: blueprint scale-hyperv-neutron-agent

Change-Id: Iaad9d1560863ccf7092f4d01ac8ffc5c08574a0c
', 'number': 6}, {'created': '2015-10-16 09:20:25.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Hyper-V Code Decomposed

As part of blueprint implementation to accommodate the
review comments to move vendor specific code to their
respective repository Hyper-V files were deleted.

After this commit the firewall configuration will change.
The new path to firewall driver will be following
firewall_driver=hyperv.neutron.security_groups_driver.HyperVSecurityGroupsDriver

Depends-On: I2bf598e1d183b13da0ed5c18ffc19cb800732b23

the log output mechanism has been already implemented in oslo.log[1],
this patch just adds "resource" information to log.

Followings are sample executed "neutron net-create".
 *configure file
   logging_context_format_string =
       %(asctime)s.%(msecs)03d %(color)s%(levelname)s %(name)s
       [%(request_id)s %(user_name)s %(project_id)s%(color)s]

  LOG.debug("network create success", resource=rscdict)

  DEUG [req-1667753a-e5f5-4417-bd8d-16f12bcc2e34 admin

Closes-Bug: #1468723
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Output resource uuid when a resource is created

the log output mechanism has been already implemented in oslo.log[1],
this patch just adds "resource" information to log.

Followings are sample executed "neutron net-create".
 *configure file
   logging_context_format_string =
       %(asctime)s.%(msecs)03d %(color)s%(levelname)s %(name)s
       [%(request_id)s %(user_name)s %(project_id)s%(color)s]
       %(resource)s%(color)s%(message)s

 *souruce file
  rscdict = {'type': 'network',
             'id': '8e6a748c-aa8a-440b-904a-a6e2f6dc00eb'}
  LOG.debug("network create success", resource=rscdict)

 *log file
  DEUG [req-1667753a-e5f5-4417-bd8d-16f12bcc2e34 admin
       0862ba8c3497455a8fdf40c49f0f2644] [network-8e6a748c-
       aa8a-440b-904a-a6e2f6dc00eb] network create success

 [1]
 https://review.openstack.org/#/c/144813/

Change-Id: I789cefa4d1b742562d3d54e25f0932032e74dd68
Closes-Bug: #1468723

commit_message:
IP Address Auto-Completion with FWaaS Command

Neutron FWaaS currently allows users to specify IP addresses
in incomplete formats in commands such as
"neutron firewall-rule-create", but does not translate it into
the complete format -- for example, if a "--source-ip-address"
is set to "1/32", it will be registered in the database as "1/32",
instead of "1.0.0.0/32". The patch ensures that the IP address is
registered in the complete format.

because it is complemented by FW rule creation from the horizon or
other neutron commands,
fwaas complements the IP address as well as their
such as the options to specify the IP address
is set the "1/32", and it is registered as "1.0.0.0/32" on database
the case of the above example.

Change-Id: I494f84d6ba318264d747f983904130841f1e2c19

version. I included a config dump for convenience (think long running
process when the process startup config dump was long long ago).

To fire handler kill -s SIGUSR1 [pid].

commit_message:
DO NOT MERGE: Trying out Guru Meditation Report

I posited that it would be nice to have a way to get a thread dump (a-la
JVM) on a running process then realized we have Guru Meditation Reports
in oslo_reports.

To fire handler kill -s SIGUSR1 [pid].

Change-Id: If288ef2392388dc7079c6aa739446928187f97db

commit_message:
Change log level warn to debug to avoid frequent warn

"No DHCP agents available, skipping rescheduling" is reported
 so frequently in function remove_networks_from_down_agents when
 there is none active agent.the log is not very useful but so
 many log will make it difficult to read log information.

Closes-bug: #1492773

Change-Id: I7a1524834c8f970381e40681f532bf8d9916693e

subject: Only use lsb_release for distro tags
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-12-03 23:50:33.000000000', 'files': ['tools/create-stack-user.sh', 'clean.sh', 'tools/info.sh', 'functions-common', 'unstack.sh', 'tools/install_prereqs.sh', 'stack.sh'], 'message': "Only use lsb_release for distro tags

The existing GetOSVersion has a lot of unused code which is wrong in
several ways

 - the only path tested in upstream CI is with lsb_release, because
   it's pre-installed on all nodes

 - the /etc/redhat-release checking probably still works, but is
   unnecessary

 - If using lsb_release, os_UPDATE has never actually been set.

 - the /etc/SuSE-release branch checking is broken if the lsb package
   is actually installed.  lsb checking does not set os_UPDATE but yet
   the SuSE DISTRO setting relies on this to set a patch level (and so
   does some of the rpm tags).  SuSE 11 is up to update 3, but the rpm
   matching is stuck hard-coded to update 2.  I'm guessing
   installation is actually broken there.

 - the debian checking branch is broken.  The VERSION tags have been
   removed and were not supposed to be relied on anyway (see notes in
   [1])

This simplifies things:

 - remove OSX checking (moved here after discussions in
   I31d0fdd30928ecc8d959a95838b1d3affd28ac6f)

 - only use the output of lsb_release.

 - A small best-effort check to pre-install lsb packages if not
   detected (that avoids chicken-egg-problem of package-install
   wrappers relying on os_* flags).

 - The unset os_UPDATE is removed.  It's only previous use was for
   setting separate suse versions in the DISTRO element for matching
   during package installs (since removed) -- the same could be
   achieved by parsing os_RELEASE if required.

[1] http://sources.debian.net/src/base-files/7.5/debian/changelog/

Change-Id: I46a2c36d95327087085df07cb797eb91249a893c

foo

Change-Id: Iefe4bb61a6e25ecf7aa07639332329352139a38f
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Only use lsb_release for distro tags

The existing GetOSVersion has a lot of unused code which is wrong in
several ways

 - the only path tested in upstream CI is with lsb_release, because
   it's pre-installed on all nodes

 - the /etc/redhat-release checking probably still works, but is
   unnecessary

 - If using lsb_release, os_UPDATE has never actually been set.

 - the /etc/SuSE-release branch checking is broken if the lsb package
   is actually installed.  lsb checking does not set os_UPDATE but yet
   the SuSE DISTRO setting relies on this to set a patch level (and so
   does some of the rpm tags).  SuSE 11 is up to update 3, but the rpm
   matching is stuck hard-coded to update 2.  I'm guessing
   installation is actually broken there.

 - the debian checking branch is broken.  The VERSION tags have been
   removed and were not supposed to be relied on anyway (see notes in
   [1])

This simplifies things:

 - remove OSX checking (moved here after discussions in
   I31d0fdd30928ecc8d959a95838b1d3affd28ac6f)

 - only use the output of lsb_release.

 - A small best-effort check to pre-install lsb packages if not
   detected (that avoids chicken-egg-problem of package-install
   wrappers relying on os_* flags).

 - The unset os_UPDATE is removed.  It's only previous use was for
   setting separate suse versions in the DISTRO element for matching
   during package installs (since removed) -- the same could be
   achieved by parsing os_RELEASE if required.

[1] http://sources.debian.net/src/base-files/7.5/debian/changelog/

Change-Id: I46a2c36d95327087085df07cb797eb91249a893c

Optimize "open" method with context manager

Replace the classic open() with opening context manager to open
files which is in the create_iscsi_target methods of volume targets.

commit_message:
Remove version from setup.cfg

Per [1] we now want to use the git repository for knowing the version instead
of just trying to modify the setup.cfg file.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-November/080692.html

Change-Id: I790506ea15e67f0cdeaed62b5b87a7d51c589e7b
Depends-On: I001a18895489a56eb55a5eb8c73ab6a3d4b1d4d0

commit_message:
Delete python bytecode before every test run

Bring over the cleaning line from run_tests.sh for the pyc files to
all the tox runs.

This should eliminate the need to clean -x -i to kill pyc files in
your local directory to get tests to pass.

Change-Id: Ib095a107537446d6e43a222cf68f7b84b9368f60
Closes-Bug: #1368661

commit_message:
Delete python bytecode before every test run

Bring over the cleaning line from run_tests.sh for the pyc files to
all the tox runs.

This should eliminate the need to clean -x -i to kill pyc files in
your local directory to get tests to pass.

Change-Id: I0f59c977411d20751a26cac39504c51896b2eab8
Closes-Bug: #1368661

subject: Fix PostgreSQL root functions
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-09 20:11:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fix PostgreSQL root functions

The default PostgreSQL administration account is 'postgres'.

This account always exists and cannot be removed.
Its attributes and access can however be altered.

Clients can connect from the localhost or remotely via TCP/IP:

Local clients (e.g. psql) can connect from a preset *system* account
called 'postgres'.
This system account has no password and is *locked* by default,
so that it can be used by *local* users only.
It should *never* be enabled (or it's password set)!!!
That would just open up a new attack vector on the system account.

Remote clients should use a build-in *database* account of the same
name. It's password can be changed using the "ALTER USER" statement.

Access to this account is disabled by Trove exposed only once the
superuser access is requested.

In the current implementation Trove uses the 'postgres' account and
return a new superuser called 'root' when the root access is requested.
The user 'root' has however no special meaning in PostgreSQL and the
existing applications may rely on the default superuser name 'postgres'.

This patch includes the following fixes:

 - Make Trove create and use its own administrative account (os_admin).
 - Disable (disable logins) the built-in 'postgres' account by default.
 - Enable and return the 'postgres' user when the root access is
   requested.
 - Fix failure on repeated 'root-enable' calls. The new implementation
   just regenerates the user's password.
 - Prevent users from hijacking the 'os_admin' account by allowing only
   local access.
 - Use the existing framework to generate secure passwords.

Notes:

 The current implementation is broken for variaous reasons:

 - It uses UUIDs in place of 'secure' password.
 - It creates a 'root' user, but no database for it.
   The clients won't be able to authenticate without explicitly
   providing an existing database name.
 - The created 'root' user has no 'SUPERUSER' attribute and
   hence is not a real superuser (cannot perform certain tasks)...
 - The implementation suffers a defect that allows a non-root user
   gain root access to an instance without marking is as 'root-enabled'
   A similar defect exists in other datastores (MySQL) too:

     1. Create an instance.
     2. Enable root.
     3. Use your root access to change the password of the built-in
        'postgres' account (Trove will still work because it uses the
        'peer' authentication method - the UNIX account).
     4. Login as 'postgres' using the changed password and drop the
        created 'root' account.
     5. Backup & restore the instance.
     6. Trove reports the root has never been enabled (it checks for existence of
        superuser accounts other than the built-in 'postgres').
     7. You enjoy the root access of the 'postgres' user
        (the password is not reset on restore).

Change-Id: Ie56ac0850bf4de742ce7841195ce29ca3b30c9ef
Closes-Bug: 1514569

commit_message:
Fix PostgreSQL root functions

The default PostgreSQL administration account is 'postgres'.

This account always exists and cannot be removed.
Its attributes and access can however be altered.

Clients can connect from the localhost or remotely via TCP/IP:

Local clients (e.g. psql) can connect from a preset *system* account
called 'postgres'.
This system account has no password and is *locked* by default,
so that it can be used by *local* users only.
It should *never* be enabled (or it's password set)!!!
That would just open up a new attack vector on the system account.

Remote clients should use a build-in *database* account of the same
name. It's password can be changed using the "ALTER USER" statement.

Access to this account is disabled by Trove exposed only once the
superuser access is requested.

In the current implementation Trove uses the 'postgres' account and
return a new superuser called 'root' when the root access is requested.
The user 'root' has however no special meaning in PostgreSQL and the
existing applications may rely on the default superuser name 'postgres'.

This patch includes the following fixes:

 - Make Trove create and use its own administrative account (os_admin).
 - Disable (disable logins) the built-in 'postgres' account by default.
 - Enable and return the 'postgres' user when the root access is
   requested.
 - Fix failure on repeated 'root-enable' calls. The new implementation
   just regenerates the user's password.
 - Prevent users from hijacking the 'os_admin' account by allowing only
   local access.
 - Use the existing framework to generate secure passwords.
 - Stop using the system 'postgres' user to execute command-line client
   calls. Communicate with database via a native Python interface
   (like other datastores) instead.
 - Remove unnecessary complex result-set caching on the guest.
 - Simplify the status-checking code using the native exceptions.
   Avoid performing complex checks with uncertain benefits
   (i.e. attempt to guess the state of the process).

Notes:

 The current implementation is broken for variaous reasons:

 - It uses UUIDs in place of 'secure' password.
 - It creates a 'root' user, but no database for it.
   The clients won't be able to authenticate without explicitly
   providing an existing database name.
 - The created 'root' user has no 'SUPERUSER' attribute and
   hence is not a real superuser (cannot perform certain tasks)...
 - The implementation suffers a defect that allows a non-root user
   gain root access to an instance without marking is as 'root-enabled'
   A similar defect exists in other datastores (MySQL) too:

     1. Create an instance.
     2. Enable root.
     3. Use your root access to change the password of the built-in
        'postgres' account (Trove will still work because it uses the
        'peer' authentication method - the UNIX account).
     4. Login as 'postgres' using the changed password and drop the
        created 'root' account.
     5. Backup & restore the instance.
     6. Trove reports the root has never been enabled (it checks for
        existence of superuser accounts other than the built-in
        'postgres').
     7. You enjoy the root access of the 'postgres' user
        (the password is not reset on restore).

Depends-On: I9d6b3df5bebc3c499cea8306f5a1a6bab18adef6
Change-Id: Ie56ac0850bf4de742ce7841195ce29ca3b30c9ef
Closes-Bug: 1514569

commit_message:
carbonara: move aggregated() to AggregatedTimeSerie

The plan is to deprecate TimeSerieArchive, so this patch moves the
aggregated method that we will still need to AggregatedTimeSerie. The
method now deals directly with AggregatedTimeSerie rather than
TimeSerieArchive, but works in the same way.

Change-Id: I62bde8b5972387ba33f9ef58ef664aebbe059056

commit_message:
Accept v2 params to v3 service create

v2 clouds exist. So do v3 clouds. If the cloud is v3 but the user
tries v2 names, just do the right thing.

Change-Id: Iaceff4b2e3e6faf3923ae08064c6bddb264df514

Anchor support to Octavia

Use Anchor for certificate signing to make the octavia communication
more secure. Anchor Ref url: https://github.com/openstack/anchor

subject: Put py34 first in the env order of tox
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-12-02 13:35:02.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Put py34 first in the env order of tox

To solve the problem of "db type could not be determined" on py34 we
have to run first the py34 env to, then, run py27. This patch puts py34
first on the tox.ini list of envs to avoid this problem to happen.

Change-Id: I7e279cbb3a6c4710b8361c8cc2df368bd28c3203
Closes-Bug: #1489059
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Put py34 first in the env order of tox

To solve the problem of "db type could not be determined" on py34 we
have to run first the py34 env to, then, run py27. This patch puts py34
first on the tox.ini list of envs to avoid this problem to happen.

Change-Id: I7e279cbb3a6c4710b8361c8cc2df368bd28c3203
Closes-Bug: #1489059

Fix db error when running python34 Unit tests

there is a chance that py34 related tests may fail.The following
patch fixes it.

TrivialFix

subject: keystone_user fails if auth_url ends with '/' in Openrc
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-12-03 19:50:15.000000000', 'files': ['lib/puppet/provider/keystone_user/openstack.rb'], 'message': 'keystone_user fails if auth_url ends with '/' in Openrc

Having /root/openrc with
OS_AUTH_URL='http://127.0.0.1:5000/v2.0/' (notice the "/" at the end)
makes keystone_user password verification fails.

Change-Id: If321bae1aa235ef6e6c7faead32c8056c81252dc
Closes-Bug: #1522550
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
keystone_user fails if auth_url ends with '/' in Openrc

Having /root/openrc with
OS_AUTH_URL='http://127.0.0.1:5000/v2.0/' (notice the "/" at the end)
makes keystone_user password verification fails.

Change-Id: If321bae1aa235ef6e6c7faead32c8056c81252dc
Closes-Bug: #1522550

commit_message:
Functional: only copy logs on exception

This patch adds a copy_logs as the handler with unittest's addOnException,
by doing this, we can get logs for all failed cases instead of copy them
before teardown.

If without any failed case, don't copy logs for saving time.

Partially implements: blueprint swarm-functional-testing
Change-Id: I47725d0d16735f650adf325adcf4194eb70c384d

commit_message:
Fix ZFSSA drivers' local cache bugs

- Use image_utils to retrieve an image's virtual_size on the fly.
- Fix race conditions happened when multiple bootable volumes are
created and deleted simultaneously.
- Handle a situation in iSCSI driver when custom schema are deleted.

Change-Id: I588fb6c668f2a891ab24d89fea26536dd0cd5742
Closes-Bug: #1498965

commit_message:
remove version from setup.cfg

Following the instructions that are provided in the mailing list [0].
We need to remove the version line from setup.cfg, as from now
on releases will be tagged using the release tools rather
than version being set in setup.cfg

commit_message:
Start removal of namespace package

This moves the namespace package to akanda_neutro, and adds a shim
which allows neutron to still load the plugins with the old path.
Shim can be removed once devstack plugin is updated.

Change-Id: Ie06f2087dceeff91bebd32bd33901950a282f792
Partially-Implements: blueprint convert-to-astara

subject: Detach vopt from mappings if VM is live
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-12-03 17:26:24.000000000', 'files': ['nova_powervm/virt/powervm/media.py'], 'message': "Detach vopt from mappings if VM is live

AIX can't handle having its VOpt mapping removed while it's live.  We
can see VIOS errors like:

HTTP error 500 for method POST on path
/rest/api/uom/VirtualIOServer/656B0AC3-35D4-4E06-892E-FD3EACA09737?gro
up=ViosSCSIMapping: Internal Server Error -- [PVME0105FF05-0187] Command
drmgr -c slot -s 'U8247.22L.212E63A-V6-C3' -r returned 1. Additional
messages:
0931-029 The specified slot contains a device or devices that are
currently configured. Unconfigure the following device or devices with
the rmdev command and try again.

In this change set, we check whether the VM is live, and if so, rather
than deleting the mapping entirely, we remove the Storage and
TargetDevice fields, thus detaching the storage from the mapping.

Change-Id: I9205f471628788fc7e5230bee0944b2c2434c1d2
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Detach vopt from mappings if VM is live

AIX can't handle having its VOpt mapping removed while it's live.  We
can see VIOS errors like:

HTTP error 500 for method POST on path
/rest/api/uom/VirtualIOServer/656B0AC3-35D4-4E06-892E-FD3EACA09737?gro
up=ViosSCSIMapping: Internal Server Error -- [PVME0105FF05-0187] Command
drmgr -c slot -s 'U8247.22L.212E63A-V6-C3' -r returned 1. Additional
messages:
0931-029 The specified slot contains a device or devices that are
currently configured. Unconfigure the following device or devices with
the rmdev command and try again.

In this change set, we check whether the VM is live, and if so, rather
than deleting the mapping entirely, we remove the Storage and
TargetDevice fields, thus detaching the storage from the mapping.

Change-Id: I9205f471628788fc7e5230bee0944b2c2434c1d2

subject: Don't remove vOpt mapping on live migrate
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-12-03 21:47:22.000000000', 'files': ['nova_powervm/tests/virt/powervm/test_live_migration.py', 'nova_powervm/virt/powervm/media.py', 'nova_powervm/tests/virt/powervm/test_media.py', 'nova_powervm/virt/powervm/live_migration.py'], 'message': "Don't remove vOpt mapping on live migrate

Some operating systems are unable to remove a device when it is in use.
However, during a live migrate, we can't migrate the the virtual optical
device.

The current live migrate code was removing the virtual optical media,
but also was removing the mapping.  This change updates it to leave the
mapping (so that operating systems that can't remove the bus are OK),
but to detach the vopt device from it.  We still remove the virtual
optical media.

Change-Id: Id2a3216ec06e95a538fa2f9f25463c490d69f81f
Closes-Bug: 1522222
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Don't remove vOpt mapping on live migrate

Some operating systems are unable to remove a device when it is in use.
However, during a live migrate, we can't migrate the the virtual optical
device.

The current live migrate code was removing the virtual optical media,
but also was removing the mapping.  This change updates it to leave the
mapping (so that operating systems that can't remove the bus are OK),
but to detach the vopt device from it.  We still remove the virtual
optical media.

Change-Id: Id2a3216ec06e95a538fa2f9f25463c490d69f81f
Closes-Bug: 1522222

commit_message:
Don't remove vOpt mapping on live migrate

Some operating systems are unable to remove a device when it is in use.
However, during a live migrate, we can't migrate the the virtual optical
device.

The current live migrate code was removing the virtual optical media,
but also was removing the mapping.  This change updates it to leave the
mapping (so that operating systems that can't remove the bus are OK),
but to detach the vopt device from it.  We still remove the virtual
optical media.

Change-Id: Id2a3216ec06e95a538fa2f9f25463c490d69f81f
Closes-Bug: 1522222

commit_message:
Adding support for editing active cluster shares

This adds the ability to add or remove manila shares
on clusters that are in the active state.

Change-Id: Ibf8b1e8db38021bdaa4fd74f8a2f548d595b2954
Partial-Implements: bp sahara-add-shares-to-clusters

commit_message:
Adding manila shares as an option for data sources

Data sources located on a Manila share are now
an option in the create data source UI.  Also including
a unit test.

Change-Id: Ic3b3f2469eb05e53d819b7df50b5632c7bdad94c
Partial-Implements: bp manila-as-a-data-source

commit_message:
Adding support for Manila-based shares in Sahara

The Sahara data processing service now supports manila
shares as a location for job binaries.  Also adding a unit
test for creation of manila-based job binaries.

Change-Id: I06a21cd159de76aa7b70f6f26af3dad2d14598b6
Implements: bp add-manila-binary-store

subject: Servicegroup foundational refactoring for Control Plane
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7, 'name': 'Jay Pipes', 'email': 'jaypipes@gmail.com', 'username': 'jaypipes'}, {'_account_id': 782, 'name': 'John Garbutt', 'email': 'john@johngarbutt.com', 'username': 'johngarbutt'}, {'_account_id': 1297, 'name': 'Joshua Harlow', 'email': 'jxharlow@godaddy.com', 'username': 'harlowja'}, {'_account_id': 2271, 'name': 'Michael Still', 'email': 'mikal@stillhq.com', 'username': 'mikalstill'}, {'_account_id': 4393, 'name': 'Dan Smith', 'email': 'dms@danplanet.com', 'username': 'danms'}, {'_account_id': 4690, 'name': 'melanie witt', 'display_name': 'melwitt', 'email': 'melwittt@gmail.com', 'username': 'melwitt'}, {'_account_id': 7166, 'name': 'Sylvain Bauza', 'email': 'sbauza@redhat.com', 'username': 'sbauza'}, {'_account_id': 10263, 'name': 'Vilobh Meshram', 'email': 'vilobhmm@yahoo-inc.com', 'username': 'vilobhmm'}, {'_account_id': 11600, 'name': 'Michał Dulko', 'email': 'mdulko@redhat.com', 'username': 'dulek'}, {'_account_id': 12898, 'name': 'Tony Breeds', 'email': 'tony@bakeyournoodle.com', 'username': 'tonyb'}, {'_account_id': 18247, 'name': 'Mark Doffman', 'email': 'mdoffman@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'doffm'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-09-11 00:53:55.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Servicegroup foundational refactoring for Control Plane

At present, there are various interfaces through which services data can
be manipulated - admin interface(nova-manage), extensions
(contrib/services.py), servicegroup API layer. Having different
interfaces to manipulate the source of truth can lead to severe
data inconsistency for something as useful as stored in nova.services.
The proposal is to follow a common path, while interacting with services
data, for all the three interfaces mentioned above. This common path will
go through the servicegroup layer, who's primary purpose is to manage
and check for service liveliness. Doing so will help to overcome the
tight coupling between nova and services database and also have a
consistent view of services data, service liveliness, etc.

Change-Id: I3cae9495373c4334fedb18b64d907f3a6ac5ab92
Previously-approved: liberty
Implements: blueprint servicegroup-api-control-plane
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-10-01 17:52:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Servicegroup foundational refactoring for Control Plane

At present, there are various interfaces through which services data can
be manipulated - admin interface(nova-manage), extensions
(contrib/services.py), servicegroup API layer. Having different
interfaces to manipulate the source of truth can lead to severe
data inconsistency for something as useful as stored in nova.services.
The proposal is to follow a common path, while interacting with services
data, for all the three interfaces mentioned above. This common path will
go through the servicegroup layer, who's primary purpose is to manage
and check for service liveliness. Doing so will help to overcome the
tight coupling between nova and services database and also have a
consistent view of services data, service liveliness, etc.

commit_message:
Servicegroup foundational refactoring for Control Plane

At present, there are various interfaces through which services data
can  be manipulated - admin interface(nova-manage), extensions
(contrib/services.py), etc. Every interface relies on the servicegroup
layer API is_up() to get details about service live-ness. The proposal
is keep service data in nova database nova.services table and fetch
the live-ness information from the configured servicegroup(SG) driver.
Liveness will be a combination of service live-ness and RPC live-ness,
where the later will be computed based on information in nova.services.

Previously-approved: liberty
Implements: blueprint servicegroup-api-control-plane

Change-Id: I3cae9495373c4334fedb18b64d907f3a6ac5ab92

commit_message:
HOT outputs were merged

This commit does dot HOT template outputs (for Heat.HOT/1.0 format)
the same that was previously done for the inputs. Instead of generating
MuranoPL property per each output now all outputs are put into a
single 'templateOutputs' property. This allows to eliminate the constraints
on output names, not to have collisions with input names and remain
consistent with previous changes.

Change-Id: Ibbd0a2f410c55385cd3cb9e85ea135a36460afe7
Closes-Bug: #1520954

'dmccowan@cisco.com', 'username': 'dave-mccowan'}, {'_account_id': 11970, 'name': 'Chelsea Winfree', 'email': 'chelsea.winfree@gmail.com', 'username': 'chellygel'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-12-02 19:53:29.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/.placeholder', 'releasenotes/source/unreleased.rst', '.gitignore', 'test-requirements.txt', 'releasenotes/source/_static/.placeholder', 'releasenotes/source/liberty.rst', 'releasenotes/source/index.rst', 'tox.ini', 'releasenotes/source/conf.py'], 'message': "Add reno for release notes management

This cycle, to address these problems for our ever-growing set of
projects, the release management team is introducing a new tool for
handling release notes as files in-tree, to allow us to simply and
continuously build the release notes for stable branch point releases
and milestones on the master branch. The idea is to use small YAML
files, usually one per note or patch, to avoid merge conflicts on
backports and then to compile those files in a deterministic way
into a more readable document for readers. Files containing release
notes can be including in patches directly, or you can create a
separate patch with release notes if you want to document a feature
than spans several patches.  The tool is called Reno, and it currently
supports ReStructuredText and Sphinx for converting note input files
to HTML for publication.  Reno is git branch-aware, so we can have
separate release notes documents for each release series published
together from the master build.

-- Excerpted from Doug Hellmann's email to the mailing list
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-November/078301.html

For more information about Reno:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/reno/

Change-Id: I4028d52f5e67d2873b3dc9df279f78a15c35d84f
(cherry picked from commit 1519d5a0862178d9b5351447214835adb8b1ac2c)

Change-Id: I4028d52f5e67d2873b3dc9df279f78a15c35d84f
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Add reno for release notes management

This cycle, to address these problems for our ever-growing set of
projects, the release management team is introducing a new tool for
handling release notes as files in-tree, to allow us to simply and
continuously build the release notes for stable branch point releases
and milestones on the master branch. The idea is to use small YAML
files, usually one per note or patch, to avoid merge conflicts on
backports and then to compile those files in a deterministic way
into a more readable document for readers. Files containing release
notes can be including in patches directly, or you can create a
separate patch with release notes if you want to document a feature
than spans several patches.  The tool is called Reno, and it currently
supports ReStructuredText and Sphinx for converting note input files
to HTML for publication.  Reno is git branch-aware, so we can have
separate release notes documents for each release series published
together from the master build.

-- Excerpted from Doug Hellmann's email to the mailing list
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-November/078301.html

For more information about Reno:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/reno/

Change-Id: I4028d52f5e67d2873b3dc9df279f78a15c35d84f
(cherry picked from commit 1519d5a0862178d9b5351447214835adb8b1ac2c)

Conflicts:
	test-requirements.txt

Change-Id: I4028d52f5e67d2873b3dc9df279f78a15c35d84f

off, repair or log. This leverages the oslo_config validation.

commit_message:
Neutron: Use generated configuration files if available

Generate the neutron core sample config files by using the oslo
generator. The files are generated with a .sample extension and
replace the static example configuration files.

Once the generation code is delivered, the static config files
will be removed.

Change-Id: Ic37a16b6cf8eb92030649f1fc8b198738a8cc104
Related-blueprint: autogen-neutron-conf-file
Partial-bug: #1199963
Depends-On: I1c6dc4e7d479f1b7c755597caded24a0f018c712
Co-Authored-By: Louis Taylor <louis@kragniz.eu>

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-07-16 02:40:26.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Update device info for FIP paired port w/unbound

When an unbound port gets associated with an FIP entry in DVR
environment, this port needs to be identified as a DVR service port
in order for DVR schedulers to know it is serviceable by DVR routers.
If a FIP port is paired with a VM hosted port, which falls into the
unbound port case, its host and device info needs to get updated.
Once the paired port's host and device info get updated, it is tagged
as a DVR service port. There are use cases the tenant will use the
unbound port in DVR environment such as "VRRP".

Without this fix, there is a chance that FIP agent gateway port will
get deleted on the DVR host as the system would think there is no
DVR service port presented, because this port is not tagged as DVR
serviceable. This would happen when a port is disassociated from
floating IP entry. At that point, system performs the check if FIP
agent gateway port is DVR serviceable on the host based on the device
owner type. If it is not, the port get deleted. However, in reality,
this port should not get deleted.

Change-Id: I7f17630550e203535421c55721c9d9486d6435aa
Closes-Bug: #1475096

', 'number': 4}, {'created': '2015-07-17 18:34:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Handle unbound allowed_address_pair FIP with DVR

When an unbound allowed_address_pair port gets associated with an FIP
entry in DVR, this port needs to be identified as a DVR service port.
If an allowed-address-pair port associated with a Floating IP is
configured to a VM port, the allowed-address-pair port will need to
adopt the VM port's host binding to be DVR serviceable.

When a port get disassociated from floating IP entry, system would
perform the check whether this FIP agent gateway port is DVR
serviceable on the host based on the device owner type. If it is not,
this port can get removed. However, if this port is in used meaning it
is bound with a host that has same device owner as the VM host port, it
should remain in the system.

VRRP is one of use cases for this scenario.

Change-Id: I7f17630550e203535421c55721c9d9486d6435aa
Closes-Bug: #1475096
", 'number': 5}, {'created': '2015-07-17 22:46:20.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Handle unbound allowed_address_pair FIP with DVR

If an allowed-address-pair port associated with a Floating IP is configured to
a VM port, the allowed-address-pair port will need to adopt the VM port's host
binding to be DVR serviceable.

Change-Id: I7f17630550e203535421c55721c9d9486d6435aa

commit_message:
Handle unbound allowed_address_pair FIP with DVR

If an allowed-address-pair port associated with a Floating IP is configured to
a VM port, the allowed-address-pair port will need to adopt the VM port's host
binding to be DVR serviceable.

DocImpact
Change-Id: I7f17630550e203535421c55721c9d9486d6435aa
Closes-Bug: #1475096

commit_message:
Update puppet-neutron Hiera config

To reflect new changes [1], we need to update the Hiera config, so we
don't have a warning when running Puppet.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/puppet-neutron/commit/46d6242644d580d3bfa7c21e20a2bccefbc0db9e

Change-Id: Ica99759aa3f56c4b243e7199306de37c6f597bee
(cherry picked from commit 2f99f0161606c4003e6b886b5701ffe06dd3da06)

subject: Remove pylint from the default list of tox targets
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-12-02 21:07:14.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Remove pylint from the default list of tox targets

There is no such target defined, so when you execute it, it just runs
unit tests one more time. pylint calls are embedded into pep8 job, so
there is no need to have it separate in the first place.

Change-Id: I4f819cf92f32a95e9422f704f5f3e5930a7a1d1f
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Remove pylint from the default list of tox targets

There is no such target defined, so when you execute it, it just runs
unit tests one more time. pylint calls are embedded into pep8 job, so
there is no need to have it separate in the first place.

Change-Id: I4f819cf92f32a95e9422f704f5f3e5930a7a1d1f

subject: Support os-endpoint-type
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-09-21 21:59:04.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometerclient/client.py'], 'message': 'Support os-endpoint-type

Ceilometerclient will always get publicURL even though we specify
endpoint type via arguments, it is because we call kesytone session
with wrong keyword argument, which should be interface rather than
endpoint_type.

see: https://github.com/openstack/python-keystoneclient/blob/master/keystoneclient/auth/identity/base.py

Change-Id: Ic2b03bd900d913c7efd22c9b91dfaa79e0cdd4bc
Closes-Bug: #1396493
(cherry picked from commit dbf003ac6f39279cf1685d82b70d50a798d8b445)
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Support os-endpoint-type

Ceilometerclient will always get publicURL even though we specify
endpoint type via arguments, it is because we call kesytone session
with wrong keyword argument, which should be interface rather than
endpoint_type.

see: https://github.com/openstack/python-keystoneclient/blob/master/keystoneclient/auth/identity/base.py

Change-Id: Ic2b03bd900d913c7efd22c9b91dfaa79e0cdd4bc
Closes-Bug: #1396493
(cherry picked from commit dbf003ac6f39279cf1685d82b70d50a798d8b445)

commit_message:
Refactor Home controller

This makes use of previously created services so that we can remove this
logic from the controller, delegating it to the specialized services,
keeping the controller thin.

commit_message:
Enable coverage reporting.

This patch enables code coverage reporting during unit tests via
the `karma-coverage` plugin, and writes them in HTML form to the
`cover` directory where they can be collected as part of the test
job output.

Change-Id: Ic280664eaf5d5f85acfaeb3f54b314129e9ed786

commit_message:
Add Project Service

This service is responsible for performing operations on multiple
projects at a time, so that we can remove this logic from our
controllers, making it easier to understand and test.

Change-Id: If3d0bde9b05bf44fbab7ff73b04c9028e1f298f0

commit_message:
Add factory to create Project models

This is the first step toward removing the business logic that currently
lives in the controllers, making them responsible for too much, into
specific objects that know how to perform them.

This allows us to have better tests and will also allow our controller
to be a lot thinner in the following commits (also allowing for
better/easier tests).

Co-Authored-By: Caio Carrara <ccarrara@thoughtworks.com>
Change-Id: I5499876b9fbbfcd616a2f5d823c416f4fee3ddbe

commit_message:
Send extra_kernel_options on pxe_append_params

When we started using ironic pxe template, we lost the ability
to send extra_kernel_options. According to our conversations, this
should be sent on pxe_append_params.
As this element was already being used for screen, I decided to make
this step a bit more generalist, and also send the extra_kernel_options
on same task.

Change-Id: I6c4a5eeb64185cc91c29b169349fff426cc53334

commit_message:
(WIP) Test pupept-openstack modules on more Puppet

  This commit adds the jobs needed to test the old style of packaging
  opensource Puppet and the new PC1[1] style.

  Without this our modules are stuck at validating beaker tests on
  3.8.x.

  [1] http://docs.puppetlabs.com/puppet/4.3/reference/whered_it_go.html

Change-Id: Idfd92acab9c6bd74cfdb3352adbd431dce6507ae

reporting for the nova-powervm, networking-powervm, and
ceilometer-powervm projects in openstack-powervm

commit_message:
Support "server list" searching by both image name and ID.

Nova API only supports list servers searching by image ID.
In OSC, we can support both image name and ID by mapping
the name to ID.

This patch also fix the inconsistent doc in .py and .rst files.

Closes-Bug: 1521492

Change-Id: I70613843f82d74732bd32a457cd4a31aba57825f

the name to ID.

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-19 13:14:23.000000000', 'files': ['nova/servicegroup/drivers/db.py', 'nova/tests/unit/servicegroup/test_db_servicegroup.py'], 'message': 'Handle DB failures in servicegroup DB driver

Fix an issue where when local conductor is used, the DB driver for
servicegroup will not handle transient DB problems gracefully.  The
patch makes the behavior consistent with messaging timeouts if remote
conductor is used.

Change-Id: Ie736e7b64ea4f60f78878c8713ce826702f9f05e
Closes-Bug: 1505471
(cherry picked from commit 5252bba03e43c71f90cb2a657e6a7f396d04be75)
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Handle DB failures in servicegroup DB driver

Fix an issue where when local conductor is used, the DB driver for
servicegroup will not handle transient DB problems gracefully.  The
patch makes the behavior consistent with messaging timeouts if remote
conductor is used.

Change-Id: Ie736e7b64ea4f60f78878c8713ce826702f9f05e
Closes-Bug: 1505471
(cherry picked from commit 5252bba03e43c71f90cb2a657e6a7f396d04be75)

subject: Disable clean_nodes by default
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1926, 'name': 'Derek Higgins', 'email': 'derekh@redhat.com', 'username': 'derekh'}, {'_account_id': 4328, 'name': 'Steven Hardy', 'email': 'shardy@redhat.com', 'username': 'shardy'}, {'_account_id': 8449, 'name': 'Marios Andreou', 'email': 'marios@redhat.com', 'username': 'marios'}, {'_account_id': 10239, 'name': 'Dmitry Tantsur', 'email': 'dtantsur@protonmail.com', 'username': 'dtantsur'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-18 14:49:43.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': '[stable/liberty] Disable clean_nodes by default

This patch sets the conductor/clean_nodes configuration option for Ironic to False by default. To maintain the same behavior of the old ramdisk.

The tripleoclient `openstack baremetal introspection bulk`
command needs to be fixed to account for the time it takes
to move from manageable to available in order to have cleaning
turned on by default.

Backport from master.

Change-Id: I23c3e7ada3da8085957e86406527e9e5202bdd69
Closes-Bug: 1517449
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-11-18 14:53:24.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': '[stable/liberty] Disable clean_nodes by default

for Ironic to False by default. To maintain the same behavior

commit_message:
Disable clean_nodes by default

This patch sets the conductor/clean_nodes configuration option
for Ironic to False by default. To maintain the same behavior
of the old ramdisk.

The tripleoclient `openstack baremetal introspection bulk`
command needs to be fixed to account for the time it takes
to move from manageable to available in order to have cleaning
turned on by default.

Change-Id: I23c3e7ada3da8085957e86406527e9e5202bdd69
Closes-Bug: 1517449
(cherry picked from commit 246d1e8595945f74095b3ec70c63f493f615eed6)

', 'number': 2}, {'created': '2015-11-01 17:54:08.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "fix DVR floating IP shortcut issue

Two things will cause DVR floating IP 'shortcut'
issue mentioned in bug #1462154:
1) DVR floating IP DNAT iptable rules will do
   DNAT to packets for VMs when they pinging
   floating IPs, which belong to VMs on the
   same router's private subnets, on the same
   host.
2) Current designment will add floating IPs onto
   rfp devices, so even we fix 1), packets will
   go to rfp devices, the wrong destinations.

This patch will try to fix the issue by:
1) fix PREROUTING rule for DVR floating IPs.
2) remove code try to add floating IPs onto rfp
   devices. And for method like 'scan_fip_ports',
   try scanning floating IP routes in fip netns
   instead.

Closes-bug: #1462154
Change-Id: Ief01769337729bd37ef7d1e9ed79b035bcc2dfa0

", 'number': 5}, {'created': '2015-11-02 14:48:47.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'fix DVR floating IP shortcut issue

Currently, there is a "shortcut" issue existing on DVR floating IP.
Image we have VM-1 and VM-2 on the same host, and their subnets are
attached onto the same router, and VM-2 has floating IP associated.
When VM-1 ping VM-2 by floating IP, its packets will directly routed
by DVR local router to VM-2, not going external network by passing
DVR edge router.
DVR floating IP DNAT iptable rules in PREROUTING chain make that
happened. Those DNAT rules will change packet destination address IP
without making judgment on it's a ingress or egress traffic.
Fixing PREROUTING rules for DVR floating IP will be one point this
patch trying to do.
After we fix DNAT rules, rfp device in DVR local router namespace,
which hosting floating IP address will "hijack" VM-1's packets to VM-2
floating IP. So this patch will also try to remove code which try
to add floating IP onto rfp device, and change methods like
"scan_fip_ports" to try scanning for floating IP routes in fip netns
instead.

Closes-bug: #1462154
Change-Id: Ief01769337729bd37ef7d1e9ed79b035bcc2dfa0
', 'number': 6}, {'created': '2015-11-02 15:11:02.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'fix DVR floating IP shortcut issue

Currently, there is a "shortcut" issue existing on DVR floating IP.
Imagine we have VM-1 and VM-2 on the same host, and their subnets are
attached onto the same router, and VM-2 has floating IP associated.
When VM-1 ping VM-2 by floating IP, its packets will directly routed
by DVR local router to VM-2, not going external network by passing
DVR edge router.
DVR floating IP DNAT iptable rules in PREROUTING chain make that
happened. Those DNAT rules will change packet destination address IP
without making judgment on it's a ingress or egress traffic.
Fixing PREROUTING rules for DVR floating IP will be one point this
patch trying to do.
After we fix DNAT rules, rfp device in DVR local router namespace,
which hosting floating IP address will get VM-1's packets to VM-2
floating IP, and stop the egree traffic going to DVR edge router.
So this patch will also try to remove code which try to add floating
IP onto rfp device, and change methods like "scan_fip_ports" to try
scanning for floating IP routes in fip netns instead.

Closes-bug: #1462154
Change-Id: Ief01769337729bd37ef7d1e9ed79b035bcc2dfa0
', 'number': 7}, {'created': '2015-11-03 10:41:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'fix DVR floating IP iptables rules

Currently it is possible for local VM traffic being forwarded directly to
the local floating IP instead of being routed via DVR edge router.

If two VMs on the same host are attached to the same local DVR router,
and at least one of the VMs has a floating IP associated with it,
then traffic between local VMs via the floating IP are passed directly
instead of being routed externally via the DVR edge router.

This is caused by DVR floating IP DNAT rules in the iptables PREROUTING chain.
The DNAT rules do not check if the traffic is ingress or egress before
changing the destination IP address of the packet. This patch will try
to fix that.

The patch also removes code which tries to add the floating IP to the rfp
device in the DVR local router namespace. Since DVR floating IP DNAT rules
no longer change destination IP address for egress traffic, the rfp device
hosting floating IP address will prevents egress traffic from reaching the
edge router.
Since rfp device in DVR local router namespace no longer hosts floating IPs,
we should modify methods such as "scan_fip_ports" to try scanning for
floating IP routes in the fip netns instead.

Closes-bug: #1462154
Change-Id: Ief01769337729bd37ef7d1e9ed79b035bcc2dfa0

commit_message:
WIP fix DVR floating IP iptables rules

WIP: will update UT and commit message later

Currently it is possible for local VM traffic being forwarded directly to
the local floating IP instead of being routed via DVR edge router.

If two VMs on the same host are attached to the same local DVR router,
and at least one of the VMs has a floating IP associated with it,
then traffic between local VMs via the floating IP are passed directly
instead of being routed externally via the DVR edge router.

This is caused by DVR floating IP DNAT rules in the iptables PREROUTING chain.
The DNAT rules do not check if the traffic is ingress or egress before
changing the destination IP address of the packet. This patch will try
to fix that.

The patch also removes code which tries to add the floating IP to the rfp
device in the DVR local router namespace. Since DVR floating IP DNAT rules
no longer change destination IP address for egress traffic, the rfp device
hosting floating IP address will prevents egress traffic from reaching the
edge router.
Since rfp device in DVR local router namespace no longer hosts floating IPs,
we should modify methods such as "scan_fip_ports" to try scanning for
floating IP routes in the fip netns instead.

Closes-bug: #1462154
Change-Id: Ief01769337729bd37ef7d1e9ed79b035bcc2dfa0

commit_message:
Add new alarm for the galera checks

This commit adds a new alarm to alert on the current mysql connection
count, based on percentage thresholds of configured maximum (80 warn,
90 critical)

Original github issue:
https://github.com/rcbops/rpc-openstack/issues/550

Depends on the following merging (this is the commit to add the new
metrics to the plugin):
https://github.com/rcbops/rpc-maas/pull/226

Change-Id: Iacd7a809b11fe3ca09deba8ee09fafbe08a13b03

commit_message:
devstack: Fix dib image location

We're building astara.qcow2 but pointing glance to akanda.qcow2.

This fixes it and should fix the dsvm-src jobs.

Change-Id: I2e87e8bdcc3ad17d8689cd74e9697dc371849006

commit_message:
[Sahara] Get urls of datasources safer

There are possible problems with retrieving datasources urls,
we can avoid that if we will wrap retrieving with try/except block.

Closes-bug: 1502854
Change-Id: I17599a8559dc0a7e33d1f70033000a01d5396dc6

subject: Put py34 first in the env order of tox
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-12-02 14:55:32.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Put py34 first in the env order of tox

To solve the problem of "db type could not be determined" on py34 we
have to run first the py34 env to, then, run py27. This patch puts py34
first on the tox.ini list of envs to avoid this problem to happen.

Change-Id: I18c626fb7dc8cc805117598946426e54fefed829
Closes-Bug: #1489059
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Put py34 first in the env order of tox

To solve the problem of "db type could not be determined" on py34 we
have to run first the py34 env to, then, run py27. This patch puts py34
first on the tox.ini list of envs to avoid this problem to happen.

Change-Id: I18c626fb7dc8cc805117598946426e54fefed829
Closes-Bug: #1489059

commit_message:
Remove db access in VNX driver

DB access should be removed in all CG related
operations. This patch is removing the DB access
in VNX driver.

Change-Id: Ifee0cdcaba41d39500c1ce7aef0d15b2737e6a20
Closes-Bug: 1511663

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-13 15:38:03.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Refactor LimitTests

Change-Id: I77d581e03dae86c299ce2e1e56164dde3c4ad72a
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-10-14 14:45:52.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Simplify LimitTests

Limit tests currently used in SQL backend testing were too complex. Due
to this complexity they could be used for SQL only. They assumed
possibility to create a domain, while it is not possible when LDAP
identity backend is used with multidomain support.

Simplify LimitTests and assume that a default domain is used for all
operations.

Change-Id: I77d581e03dae86c299ce2e1e56164dde3c4ad72a
', 'number': 2}, {'created': '2015-10-14 15:44:40.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Simplify LimitTests

Limit tests currently used for SQL backend testing are too complex.
Due to this complexity they could be used for SQL only. They assumed
possibility to create a domain, while it is not possible when LDAP
identity backend is used with multidomain support.

Simplify LimitTests and assume that a default domain is used for all
operations.

Change-Id: I77d581e03dae86c299ce2e1e56164dde3c4ad72a

commit_message:
Simplify LimitTests

Limit tests currently used for SQL backend testing are too complex.
Due to this complexity they could be used for SQL only. They assumed
possibility to create a domain, while it is not possible when LDAP
identity backend is used with multidomain support.

Simplify LimitTests and assume that a default domain is used for all
operations.

Change-Id: I77d581e03dae86c299ce2e1e56164dde3c4ad72a

commit_message:
db: Database Query Profiling

This spec proposes to introduce a way to measure db query execution
times using sqlalchemy events. This profiling information can be
very useful for tuning database performance.

Change-Id: I283877017e7f13c22eafae63ca5fd7456fa7a1ae

To solve the problem of "db type could not be determined" on py34 we
have to run first the py34 env to, then, run py27. This patch puts py34

Closes-Bug: #1489059

commit_message:
Put py34 first in the env order of tox

To solve the problem of "db type could not be determined" on py34 we
have to run first the py34 env to, then, run py27. This patch puts py34
first on the tox.ini list of envs to avoid this problem to happen.

Change-Id: Id54bb80944385579cfa136fce78cb5be55393f81
Closes-Bug: #1489059

commit_message:
Allow optionally retaining weakref(s) to listener callbacks

Instead of always having a strong reference to listener
callbacks (which can cause the garbage collector to retain
those objects unnecessarily) allow for optionally registering
the callbacks as weak (defaults to false) so that the garbage
collector can delete it as needed and earlier.

Depends-On: I3ac7ba5eaa1de3cee5739287703dd0b3565a7484

Change-Id: I3d8b1f607152cb0f5768ce6380692dca25aa50e1

commit_message:
Fixing incorrect work of the _initialize_testr method

When we execute `rally verify start —system-wide-install`, we get
"OSError: [Errno 13] Permission denied" error. So this patch is
intended to fix the issue.

Change-Id: Icb684c96c2c74fbb3ac2815387d0ea790ff3a3c5

commit_message:
Minor fixes to TLS related resources

* Fixed a comment to avoid ambiguity with concepts in Heat
* Removed default values from necessary parameters in the TLS
  environment
* Simplified setting of the cert/key into a file.

Change-Id: I351778150a6fbf7affe1a0fddb1abb9869324dfc

commit_message:
Only deploy .my.cnf file on galera/utility containers

The original bug was opened because .my.cnf (with sensitive root credentials)
was being deployed on compute hosts without needing to be there. This patch
restricts the deployment of .my.cnf files to the galera/utility containers
only. This improves security while still allowing deployers to diagnose galera
server issues on the galera server containers themselves, and to access the
database from the utility containers for diagnostic purposes.

Closes-bug: 1510596
Implements: blueprint limit-mysql-config-distribution
Change-Id: I42f39cbfcb02b97846894592d642ac0c58a82b02

commit_message:
Use flat_networks=* default for the ml2 plugin

We are setting our flat_networks setting for the ml2 plugin
manually to '' which as of neutron git commit
cb712c5a9ee2717f5d34b00a420529b842db90c7 causes a
'Flat networks are disabled' error to occur when
we attempt to create the ctlplane network.

This patch drops the configurion of flat_networks from
instack and instead relies on the puppet-neutron default
of '*' which will work.

Change-Id: I880c9a159a46d9a288cb1f8bf79af30e5045d5ab
Closes-bug: #1515315
(cherry picked from commit f9ed51c5da8d0d82a9c83e82df862f3bdd083cba)

commit_message:
Do not deprecate config var 'max_fixed_ips_per_port'

The commit 37277cf4168260d5fa97f20e0b64a2efe2d989ad marked this
as deprecated. The NSX|V plugin makes use of this. This is due
to the fact that the edge dhcp appliance only allows one mac:ip
mapping. If there is more than one then there is an exception thrown.

So we use this to prevent a user from configuring more than one
IP address per port.

Change-Id: Ib65d37e61aeac28440b1b2b6a7705447e17f010a

commit_message:
[CI] Separate NFS and CIFS tests for different jobs

Manila CI jobs fail very often exceeding timeout.
So, separate NFS and CIFS tests between jobs.
Run NFS jobs on MySQL ones and CIFS on PostgreSQL.
It splits load twice per each job.

Change-Id: Icd692a4509a3418dceb6f37c636650c80b9a8683

subject: Fix bug where clean steps do not run
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-12-03 15:09:11.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fix bug where clean steps do not run

A bug was introduced during Liberty where Ironic transparently
ignores all clean steps and finishes cleaning. This is caused
by _get_node_next_clean_steps returning an empty list when
cleaning has just started. Fix this method to return the full
list of clean steps when cleaning begins.

This may leave previous tenants' data on disk and available to future
tenants. Deployers should apply this patch (or upgrade to a new release
with this patch) ASAP.

Closes-Bug: #1517277

commit_message:
Fix bug where clean steps do not run

A bug was introduced during Liberty where Ironic transparently
ignores all clean steps and finishes cleaning. This is caused
by _get_node_next_clean_steps returning an empty list when
cleaning has just started. Fix this method to return the full
list of clean steps when cleaning begins.

This may leave previous tenants' data on disk and available to future
tenants. Deployers should apply this patch (or upgrade to a new release
with this patch) ASAP.

Closes-Bug: #1517277
(cherry picked from commit 1c700e6d62ad299e3fc9023e30b98d51408e49e1)

Change-Id: If815f81d7e668244f0d434d4e2933e8f41946107

commit_message:
Fix H404/405 violations in client.py,base.py,api_version.py

There is a lot of H404/405 violations in novaclient, and it is better
to fix those to have a better doc string for class/methods.

This patch fixes these violations for below files-
-api_versions.py
-base.py
-client.py

As there are lot of violations and cannot be fixed in single patches,
So separating those in multiple patches for easy review.

Change-Id: I30a714fc3b0b317f7ffa4a99fbb224b4d5f5477b
Partial-Bug: #1521899

commit_message:
Implement snapshots-related features for Block Device Driver

This patch adds the create_snapshot, create_volume_from_snapshot
and delete_snapshot methods to Block Device driver. It adds
synchronization also to create_volume, delete_volume, extend_volume
and create_cloned_volume.

Related blueprint: block-device-driver-minimum-features-set
Depends-On: I0d6b252db028c925bc1d57cb3790534ddee99095
Change-Id: Ifde29a523cd07bcd1a4efa245513e9fd9517a3cc
Closes-Bug: #1335904

commit_message:
Added ceilometer-polling upstart jobs

The ceilometer-central-agent and ceilometer-agent-compute
services are now completely removed from the liberty release
of ceilometer. The new implementation is to use ceilometer-polling
and call the respective pollsters by namespace.
This patch addes the neccessary upstart configurations for
ceilometer-polling and it also removes the deprecated admin_* options
from the ceilometer config file.
This patch set is also forcing ceilometer to use the Keystone
v2.0 API by adding the versioned path uder [service_credentials]
in the ceilometer config file.

Change-Id: Iba2bb148df4f3ae9d16b44c27ddff0c0d3fd29d3
UpgradeImpact
Closes-Bug: #1519423
Closes-Bug: #1519462
(cherry picked from commit 603f7b4deee1f1fa90ed014714384feb33b1e1ab)

commit_message:
Override $::os_package_type

MOS Ubuntu image uses Debian style packages. Since the introduction
of `$::os_package_type' fact avilable to use in project manifests,
we need to provide a manual override for Fuel Ubuntu images.

This commit updates the preseed template of Precise and Trusty.

Change-Id: I05ab1c189a884fddc68383d6a51641f859ba16a2
Closes-Bug: #1517513

commit_message:
Put py34 first in the env order of tox

To solve the problem of "db type could not be determined" on py34 we
have to run first the py34 env to, then, run py27. This patch puts py34
first on the tox.ini list of envs to avoid this problem to happen.

Change-Id: I2bd65c7af7c87b6c36439e6e4bb6230eca8d33ee
Closes-Bug: #1489059

commit_message:
Add 'shared' as an option to visibility in get_base_properties()

image visibility properties are 'public', 'private', 'shared', but we
only enumerate 'public' or 'private' in get_base_properties().

This commit fixes that

Closes-Bug: #1466900
Change-Id: I8cc076defd0a0da74b28827b7c053f814e465d77

subject: Add Flask-Cors to global-requirements.txt
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-23 15:33:53.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt', 'upper-constraints.txt'], 'message': "Add Flask-Cors to global-requirements.txt

A Flask extension which adds support for CORS to Flask API's.

- Is the library actively maintained?

  Yes. It has seen active development for some time. See the
  recent commit history at:
  https://github.com/corydolphin/flask-cors

- Is the library good code?

  Yes, the code looks clean and it does one thing well.

- Is the library python 3 compatible?

  Yes.

- Is the library license compatible?

  The license is MIT:
  https://github.com/corydolphin/flask-cors/blob/master/LICENSE

- Is the library already packaged in the distros we target (Ubuntu
  latest / Fedora latest)?

  Not that I can see.

- Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries
  in ``global-requirements.txt``?

  Not that I can see.

Change-Id: I89fd90d0e106aa1f95d56c547f629b0c107349bf
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Add Flask-Cors to global-requirements.txt

A Flask extension which adds support for CORS to Flask API's.

- Is the library actively maintained?

  Yes. It has seen active development for some time. See the
  recent commit history at:
  https://github.com/corydolphin/flask-cors

- Is the library good code?

  Yes, the code looks clean and it does one thing well.

- Is the library python 3 compatible?

  Yes.

- Is the library license compatible?

  The license is MIT:
  https://github.com/corydolphin/flask-cors/blob/master/LICENSE

- Is the library already packaged in the distros we target (Ubuntu
  latest / Fedora latest)?

  Not that I can see.

- Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries
  in ``global-requirements.txt``?

  Not that I can see.

Change-Id: I89fd90d0e106aa1f95d56c547f629b0c107349bf

commit_message:
Add limit param for package-list

MuranoClient does not support list packages with limit and
it returns only 20 records every time.

Change-Id: Ic56e1ae789ac14ca2f3beb5b4fa6c63579d9b9ad
Closes-bug: #1521045

commit_message:
Fix the os-extended-volumes key reference in the REST API history docs

The actual key in the response is os-extended-volumes:volumes_attached
so the REST API history doc needs to be updated for v2.3.

Change-Id: I17e8ddaf939718f737b3098357938ecd647e872c
Closes-Bug: #1511094

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-09-24 21:48:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Only create volumes with instance.az if cinder.cross_az_attach is False

Commit 6060888b58db42eea826939852838f9e1c204d2c changed the boot from
volume flow where source != 'volume' (where Nova creates the volume and
then attaches it to the instance during the server create operation)
such that the instance.availability_zone is always passed to the volume
create API.  That was done because if the cinder.cross_az_attach config
option is False then Nova requires the instance and volume AZs to be the
same when attaching the volume.

However, telling Cinder to create a volume based on the instance AZ can
fail if that AZ doesn't exist in Cinder.

Cinder commit b85d2812a8256ff82934d150dbc4909e041d8b31 works around this
by allowing Cinder to be configured to basically not fail if the
requested AZ does not exist. This is not a great solution though if you
have cinder.cross_az_attach=False in Nova because Cinder ignored your
request.  It's also terrible UX for the end user because they get a
NoValidHost when boot from volume fails.  There is a TODO in this change
to address that later (because exactly how cross-service AZs should work
is still being discussed).

This change addresses the gap introduced by always telling Cinder to
create the volume with the instance AZ.  We should only do that when
cinder.cross_az_attach is False, because that's the strict case where
Nova expects them to match.  If cross_az_attach is True, Nova doesn't
care what AZ the volume is in so we shouldn't try and accomodateforce
Cinder to accommodate the Nova AZ when creating the volume.

Closes-Bug: #1496235

Change-Id: I3d60c084fd71162a0d4835394f8e819723c1b8a7

commit_message:
Only create volumes with instance.az if cinder.cross_az_attach is False

Commit 6060888b58db42eea826939852838f9e1c204d2c changed the boot from
volume flow where source != 'volume' (where Nova creates the volume and
then attaches it to the instance during the server create operation)
such that the instance.availability_zone is always passed to the volume
create API.  That was done because if the cinder.cross_az_attach config
option is False then Nova requires the instance and volume AZs to be the
same when attaching the volume.

However, telling Cinder to create a volume based on the instance AZ can
fail if that AZ doesn't exist in Cinder.

Cinder commit b85d2812a8256ff82934d150dbc4909e041d8b31 works around this
by allowing Cinder to be configured to basically not fail if the
requested AZ does not exist. This is not a great solution though if you
have cinder.cross_az_attach=False in Nova because Cinder ignored your
request.  It's also terrible UX for the end user because they get a
NoValidHost when boot from volume fails.  There is a TODO in this change
to address that later (because exactly how cross-service AZs should work
is still being discussed).

This change addresses the gap introduced by always telling Cinder to
create the volume with the instance AZ.  We should only do that when
cinder.cross_az_attach is False, because that's the strict case where
Nova expects them to match.  If cross_az_attach is True, Nova doesn't
care what AZ the volume is in so we shouldn't try and force
Cinder to accommodate the Nova AZ when creating the volume.

Closes-Bug: #1496235

Change-Id: I3d60c084fd71162a0d4835394f8e819723c1b8a7

commit_message:
Declare multiattach is True in Dell Eqlx driver

An Eqlx volume can be attached to multi instances, however,
this feature is not declared in eqlx driver. As a result,
if a user create a multi-attached volume using eqlx as
backend, they will be failed.

In this commit, we declared multiattach is True in eqlx
driver.

Change-Id: Ia8e94e739c2573f1f26d8cb2713a6b851adf9428
Closes-Bug: #1519570

commit_message:
Add clients module to Tacker

We are invoking individual openstack clients everytime
we need it. But we need a generic openstack clients module
for code resuability. This patch does that by creating new clients.py
file in tacker/common.

Change-Id: Ibe06ff2eafa00b2825d5f412620cb4d051626164
Closes-Bug: #1518244

it checks tenants.list()

commit_message:
Fix metric-statistics doesn't respond "Conflict"

When metric-statistics without --merge_metrics is called
and which has multiple metrics matching metric name and dimensions,
it is expected to respond "409 Conflict" instead of
"500 Internal Server Error".

Change-Id: I26edf216b68385bf3bce11ba186d2b285b46874b
Closes-Bug: #1520061

commit_message:
Move Image Generation Scripts into Plugins

As Sahara matures, it will be necessary to move framework-specific plugins
into their own repositories, maintaining a backward-compatible Sahara core
separately. As such, moving image generation logic into plugins is a
critical piece of and precondition for this abstraction effort.

Change-Id: I1db69fb9ea35d317a2e1baaaac1b8945973e2d0c
Describes: blueprint image-gen-into-plugins

commit_message:
Added two precise Use Cases in the spec

The Watcher Decision Engine should query metrics from the Ceilometer 
API V2 to allow an easiest integration with OpenStack components
(especially DevStack).

commit_message:
Release Mistral 2.0.0 beta 1

Per the new process [1], we now need to tag milestones. Here is the

commit_message:
Add Google Container Registry to KubernetesCluster

Allow access to Google Container Registry using json key as
a password for docker login. The key is scoped to a specific
Google Cloud Platform Console project and its resources.
Add new field for key.

Partially implements: blueprint k8s-google-registry-support

Change-Id: Ica71d1a48ac7fb75a71497fcbe318d1b9e4e8192

commit_message:
Add Google Container Registry to DockerStandaloneHost

Allow access to Google Container Registry using json key as
a password for docker login. The key is scoped to a specific
Google Cloud Platform Console project and its resources.
Add new field for key.

Partially implements: blueprint k8s-google-registry-support

Change-Id: I904110522b482cce56a2fc14ae77eb50064b723f

commit_message:
Fix exception when doing volume set operation

The v2 SetVolume extends from show.ShowOne and returns None
after setting volume operation. It will raise an exception.
This patch is going to fix the issue by changing the parent
class of SetVolume to command.Command.

Change-Id: Iefa453fe4adad06f2a0601a052c01e74004be5b7
Closes-bug: 1521896

[{'created': '2015-12-02 14:11:05.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Provide a better comment for the object short-circuit

A previous commit was landed over a -1 from a core reviewer that was
concerned about the terse and flippant commit message that accompanied

useful for people looking at the code too, so add a more complete

commit_message:
Provide a better comment for the object short-circuit

A previous commit was landed over a -1 from a core reviewer that was
concerned about the terse and flippant commit message that accompanied
the commit. The substance of that objection was that there was no good
explanation for why the change was made. Indeed, that why is likely
useful for people looking at the code too, so add a more complete
comment on the code in question.

Change-Id: I1ff777393502edf4ef3ed595e47bfcf73be0e5e8

commit_message:
Disable ceilometer-acompute in control node example

The ceilomter devstack plugin turns on every ceilometer service by
default. This disables the ceilometer-acompute service in the control
node example file.

commit_message:
Add support for shared volumes between guests

This blueprint proposes a change to Nova to support
attaching a cinder volume to more than one instance.

Co-Authored-By: Tobias Engelbert <tobias.engelbert@ericsson.com>
Co-Authored-By: Krisztian Gacsal <krisztian.gacsal@ericsson.com>

bp multi_attach_volume

Change-Id: If728575e19aa1c553682b04f26d01dc66e467a47

commit_message:
Extend statistic benchmarks for Ceilometer

Existing benchmark scenario for statistics was not benchmark at all
it was check that statistic api works, now scenario was changed
with using new Ceilometer context and adding new configured
query parameters.

It allows to find a weak places in requesting Ceilometer data.

Change-Id: Iccde7422016e87f20237721b7fc1fb379646adf8
